Bluecliff
guide
Continued roleplay, in and out of session.
Meta Tron 30-Sep-18 11:55 PM
As we group teleport, I see some weird scene of starry night before landing us nowhere near the fucking Marshwreath we attempted to arrive at. There is some funkyass door that hums when my companions touch it, so we bail towards the town where the smoke burns. We get to the town and dumbass Jayko forgets to sneak and gets us caught in a fight. I whiff my first attack after watching my companions wreck these creepy frogmen. I could have taken a nap in the fight and been as helpful, the band destroys the creatures without my help. I fall into a fucking pit and then I get blinded by the beholder after I woke it up. Just not my day I guess...
Jayko 30-Sep-18 11:55 PM
goDAMMIT
Meta Tron 30-Sep-18 11:56 PM
take notes you fucker
Jayko 01-Oct-18 12:01 AM
Jayko does not understand why teleport is different this time, we do not land in town like we should. Jayko carries his cart long ways only to forget he is not sneaky while looking for things, he has to remember better in future days. Biggish one attempts to grab this one, but cannot. Jayko is too fast. I am sneak behind large beholder with weird eye. They are dangerous circles and should are too bright for Jayko.
Cass Allura 01-Oct-18 12:09 AM
Teleporting was a singularly unique experience, both mesmerizing and terrifying. I was a bit woozy, but all in all, I loved the experience—especially the stars. Peppering the night sky, each one is a beacon, encouraging brave explorers to witness what Creation has to offer. I often find myself lost in thought at what worlds must lie beyond our reach. Then we fell into a swamp, which was decidedly less fun. (edited)
I had been a little anxious at first to go on my first mission with these relative strangers, but after the events of the last couple weeks, I feel....hardened, I suppose? Motivated, but out of necessity. Whatever the reason, traveling went well. I even sang one of my songs for them! Granted, I’m not used to people asking questions in lieu of applause, but the Warden Rook seemed to like it, and so did Prof. Buff—in his own detached way.
Cass Allura 01-Oct-18 12:27 AM
We made our way to the village and were immediately beset by fearsome foes: bullywugs. Though they outnumbered us 2 to 1, we were able to push them back, defeating them soundly—with a little inspiration from yours truly! I shattered a few of them, distracted one with my insults, and even wielded a sword! I felt heroic and brave! It was very reminiscent of C exciting. After some investigation of the town, there was a collapse in the center of the square. Rushing there, we found that Meta and Rook had fallen into a collapsed underground bunker of some kind, with a tunnel leading further into the earth. After much walking, we seem to have triggered some sort of trap, because we were immediately blinded by some unknown entity. When my sight finally returned, I was staring something horrible in the eye—literally. A mangled conglomerate of ancient metal, whirring mechanisms, and aged patches of flesh, a half Beholder/half Warden (?) floated in front of us. And its voice...I’m still shivering, if I’m being honest. I thought for sure the fight for our lives was about to begin. I was wrong—it was somehow worse. Dammit, Locke. I know you’re busy running everything, but it’s your job to keep your staff informed! How could you have missed the bit about Twin Beholders?? Riches and freedom await us if we complete the Warden Beholder’s task—death and destruction reply if we fail. (edited)
..but we won’t fail. I won’t fail. I can’t afford to, not after what I’ve seen. We’ll take down this double (triple?) threat and return victorious to the Guild. That’s a Cass Guarantee.
Professor Buff Orpington 01-Oct-18 02:39 PM
I embarked on my first quest with the Bluecliff Adventurer’s Guild today. I would have preferred to complete this alone or with a team of qualified academics, but each member showed their own unique strength. Teleporting was a very unique experience, but I have to wonder where the designer graduated from. If I had built such a device it would have a great deal more accuracy and comfort, perhaps I can build upon it in the future. We arrived at a very interesting door in the middle of the swamps outside of Marshwreath. The stone had formed around the metal door, signalling its ancient significance. It had four padlocks marked with an anvil, a hammer, a clockwork device, and an archway. I will write to a few familiar archaeologists and anthropologists. Perhaps Professor Tinkerton, despite her more romantic orientations, can provide some insight. Rook created some kind of effect on the door that is worthy of note. He may have his uses after all. As we marched forward the weaker members requested a rest, which I obliged them with. I maintain my hiking strength from years in the mountains and could have continued forward, but it is better to collect ourselves at times I think. Cass regaled us with a song. Overall it harkened back to more traditional folk songs characteristic of Creissos’ pubs and bars. Performance was solid, lyrics were adequate. The theme was a bit immature, especially when she began elaborating on morality. Not everyone earned the honor of studying under the top philosophical minds in all of Creissos. Perhaps my next book should be a personal reflection on morality with my own viewpoints shared. Creissos lacks a prominent voice on moral philosophy and I am likely most qualified to fill such a role.
Jayko spoke on his relationship with the bullywags. The sewers sound fascinating. I wonder if a survey has been completed on them before. Perhaps Jayko can guide me in the future. It would be an interesting isolated and relatively controlled environment that could enlighten me on some issues of evolution. Marshwreath itself was a delight. We were attacked by bullywags almost immediately. Very fun. I had not fought since the unfortunate events with Lord Iarneth but I forgot the blinding euphoria of crushing and triumphing over an opponent. I look forward to a real challenge - intellectual or physical soon. I am, after all, an Orpotanu-Laga no matter how many degrees I earn, papers I write, and dress robes I wear and the triumph of conquest is undoubtedly the greatest pleasure. I personally discovered the lair of the beholder soon after, avoiding a trap as my followers fell inside the pit. I identified a tunnel clearly manufactured by the beholder and was delighted at what I saw. The beholder we met was powerful and clearly manufactured by the Duergar. I hope an accident befalls the creature because I would love to dissect it and create one of my own. My challenge is now two beholders, twins, an anomaly based on my readings of beholder research. This will make an influential book when I complete an anatomical study of the beasts and recount my triumph to the world. Perhaps Cass or Professor Regina can help make my works more palatable to a general audience. It will require my great wits and strength for my party to triumph in the coming battle.
Rook 02-Oct-18 06:07 PM
As the others have mentioned we found ourselves in front of a door at journeys beginning, it pained me to look away, but I don’t know why. It seemed to not want me to enter. Otherwise there is little of the town we meant to journey to left to protect. Hopefully when our journey ends there will be more there.
Jayko 07-Oct-18 11:54 AM
Jayko thinks this journal entry starts with big thing. Rook is lost to ashes. Jayko is contract to big eye? Jayko is not so sure, he does not feel magic. One thing is certain to this one, circles were dangerous and will harm jayko in fitire. For now jayko will try to train red frog to obey, or it will become snack
Jayko 07-Oct-18 01:48 PM
Jayko must work to improve lest his new comrades decide he is dead weight
Cass Allura 07-Oct-18 03:10 PM
Rook fell. Turned to ash right in front of me. I almost followed quickly behind. Seven villagers were left alive. We defeated the Beholder, but it doesn’t feel like a victory.
I used to think that adventurers were heroes. People who knew that death was likely, and when it occurred, they would mourn the fallen, but ultimately fight again out of the nobility for good. But I was naïve. When Rook fell, Jayko was only slightly perturbed, like he didn’t realize the severity of what happened or just didn’t care. The Prof was worse—his sadness came out of losing a potential specimen. Adventurers are not heroes who fight the good fight despite their losses. Adventurers are the detritus, the outcasts, the freaks, the heartless, and the crazy. They’re the only ones who can keep fighting to the brink of consciousness, watch their comrades die, pick up their gold, and do it all over again the next day. We’re not heroes. We’re insane people with a masochist streak a mile long.
...
..I’m angry. I know. I’m...I’m saying things that maybe I don’t mean all the way. I’m grieving, I get that. It’s just....I feel so alone. I feel directionless. I’ve never been so close to death like this, and after what I saw at the Abbey.......no. Stop. Pull yourself together. You can’t afford to falter, you can’t afford to be weak anymore. Rise up, Cass. Fight and fight and fight until nothing can stand in your path. Only then can you stop them.
..I’m getting this arm of mine fixed (hopefully). After that, I’m going to the Abbey to see Bulwart. The Beholder said maybe a priest can help. Rook. I couldn’t protect you. I’m sorry. I’m gonna bring you back big guy. I’m gonna bring you back.
Jayko 07-Oct-18 03:43 PM
written in scrawled deep speech in jaykos bark scroll The one that is Cass is too worrying. Jayko wants potions and the adventuring one is crippled from adventure. Though jayko's mind says no, he needs material. He must ask the professor of buff to be in success
Professor Buff Orpington 07-Oct-18 04:27 PM
As I continued to lead my followers down the tunnel we encountered some interesting mushrooms, Ghost Tendrils. I hope to run a test to examine if the beholder had a chemical effect on the mushrooms. I may have to defer in expertise to a trained chemist, perhaps an expert trained at the Bluecliff Academy or even Jayko. I wonder where he received his training, likely in the sewers rather than at one of Creissos’ major intellectual institutions. Nonetheless, I may need his expertise in this one instance. We reached a hallway that I deduce is related or connected to the doorway we saw upon our initial arrival outside of Marshwreath. While the others entertained themselves with a childish series of tricks and games involving rocks, I solved a puzzle that opened a doorway, with some assistance from my followers. We next came upon my twin beholders. It appeared one beholder had slain its twin beholder, as happens in the paranoid, megalomaniacal rivalries of such creatures, and sought to burn the eye of its twin with acid. Fascinating. I devised a plan to distract and overwhelm the beholder and its bullywag followers using the magic of Cass to conjure a ghost of its twin and the potions of Jayko to turn the bullywags against one another. It is likely our casualties would have been greater without my strategic mind. I ignored the weaker foes, since I had faced them before and clearly triumphed, opting for the more challenging opponent, the beholder. It was indeed a challenge. The beholder targeted me for most of the battle as its primary opposition. I was incapacitated at one point and even felt fear for the first time since I was in the mountains. Interesting. I will have to reflect on that soon. Rook was killed. Unfortunate. Not even a body to learn from. Though I was responsible for the slaying of the beholder, Meta struck the killing blow. Perhaps he has some strength to him as well.
The Duergar beholder returned and demanded the eyes, bringing us to a white plane to threaten us. I only wish he had left us with an eye. That is, after all, the source of a beholder’s power. I will obtain one soon, I’m sure. I look forward to working with it again in the future, and I hope to come to the table with more bargaining power as to my payment. I received a great deal of monetary payment for my work, though Cass took an extra share. “Rook’s share.” She is emotional and seems to think she can bring him back to life. That would be ideal. Much more to learn from him. Jayko provided me with an incapacitated sovereign grung. Excellent. A living specimen will give me a lot of freedom and accuracy in my tests. Jayko is proving to be an able-bodied lover of knowledge like myself. He may prove to be more use to me after all. He and I both understand that life ends. In the wilds we lived - the sewers for him and the mountains for me - death comes quickly and brutally. This will be an important lesson to the more naive members of my party. (edited)
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 01:11 PM
The next morning. (edited)
Cass walks into the guild, having had an early start. She is dressed similar to yesterday, with the exception of ripped and bloody clothes. What is of note is her left arm: where once there was a series of dark fissures and cracks running up gray skin, now all that remains is faint pink scarring, spider webbing lightning streaking up her ebony forearm.
With purpose, she walks briskly to Jayko’s door and knocks.
“Jayko! I need to speak with you!”
Jayko 12-Oct-18 01:20 PM
The door wasn't closed, inside you see Jayko eating fish with a large red frog and communicating with grunts, nods, and small gestures.
"The not-human who is Cass, yes?"
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 01:21 PM
“Can I come in?”
Jayko 12-Oct-18 01:24 PM
Jayko looks to the frog and tilts his head then looks back to you. The room Jayko is in is sweltering and humid and smells of unknown components that sting your eyes. "If the Cass is wanting to yes"
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 01:27 PM
Bearing the less than ideal conditions, she steps inside. “Jayko...I..before anything, I would like to apologize. Back at the lair, you went to scoop up Rook’s ashes, and I instinctively pushed you away.” She looks down, thinking hard. “I’m ashamed to say that I thought you were being heartless, intending to use the ashes for some selfish purpose. I suppose after seeing Buff’s apathetic response to Rook’s death, I assumed the worst about you, and for that, I’m sorry.”
[[I’m gonna switch to “I” phrases from now on, cause that feels more in character.]]
Jayko 12-Oct-18 01:30 PM
"Jayko does not feel loss as you do, this is true. Jayko will probably not ever understand your loss. This one does not feel like he wants others to know loss, but who is Jayko to know this?"
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 01:33 PM
I blink, a little confused, but after parcing your words, I smile. “I appreciate that, Jayko. And, just so you know, it’s ok to not feel the same things as others. If your goal is to relate to people more, than by all means, developing deeper connections is a worthwhile endeavor. But you aren’t heartless, at least from what I can tell. That’s what’s important, in my mind.”
I shift up. “That’s actually why I’m here.”
“Jayko...in our last adventure, you are someone who has proven himself reliable. You have instincts that steer you well. I need someone like that for a task I have.” “You see,” I say, pulling out the small metal object left behind in Rook’s remains, “I think I know how to bring the big guy back.”
Jayko 12-Oct-18 01:38 PM
I look at the frog sitting next to me and attempt to imitate the chirping and ribbits and head knods explaining. It blinks slowly as I look back to you. "Jayko is in need of potions, maybe is fine maybe is not. Jayko needs time to make his weapons."
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 01:39 PM
I smile. “I was hoping you would say that.”
Jayko 12-Oct-18 01:39 PM
"when Jayko does, he will be here. This one also will be, but does not wish to fight"
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 01:39 PM
I pull out a bottle, filled with a darkish brown liquid.
“Jayko, this....is Glidestep.”
Jayko 12-Oct-18 01:40 PM
"what is gladestip?"
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 01:44 PM
“Glidestep is quite remarkable. You see, it acts as a sort of burst of energy. If you’re feeling exhausted when you take it, you suddenly feel reinvigorated for awhile, ignoring your tiredness. It also hones your reflexes, allowing you to move quicker out of the way of effects that might target you.” “It also,” I say, smiling, “make you smarter. When you take this, any time you try to remember something, figure out something, anything requiring you to lean on your own intelligence, you find yourself easily able to think. It’s quite amazing, wouldn’t you say?” (edited)
Jayko 12-Oct-18 01:45 PM
"Jayko does not know, Jayko does not drink his own poisons, he puts them in others. Jayko is poisoner, not so much an alchemist"
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 01:48 PM
I frown. “Hm...that’s unfortunate. I was thinking this would be something you would like to learn how to make someday. With your particular skill set, it seemed perfect. But, if you are willing to help me with Rook regardless, that is still fantastic news!”
I walk closer to you and reach out my hand to shake yours.
Jayko 12-Oct-18 01:49 PM
Jayko has never shaken a hand before and looks mystified
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 01:51 PM
I grab your hand gently and shake it up and down. “You are so quick to agree to helping a stranger you barely know. Jayko, you may not feel loss as I do, but I think you care more than you know. At least, you show it through actions, even when you can’t find the words.” I smile genuinely at Jayko. “Thank you, Jayko, for being there for me. Together, I truly believe we can bring Rook back—and who knows, maybe even save the world.” I laugh.
Jayko 12-Oct-18 01:54 PM
"Jayko knows watching and doing is quick learning, Jayko does not understand humanity (he mispronounces this word horribly) but wants to know more" Jayko looks back to the frog and attempts to communicate a picking motion and points to the front entrance. "World is much, but Jayko understands"
he whispers quietly "Is world in danger?"
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 01:55 PM
I stare at Jayko for a moment, the conflict of decisions showing on my face.
[can you roll an insight check real quick?]
“..no, no, just a funny joke.” I laugh, but even I can tell how unconvincing it is. Maybe you can tell him soon, but not quite yet.
Jayko 12-Oct-18 01:59 PM
Jayko is tilting his head at you and obviously reading your facial expressions using eye for detail.
"Oh, this is joke. Jayko does not get." (edited)
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 02:03 PM
I blink. “Ha. Hahaha yes, that’s ok, Jayko!” Relief washes over me. “It was a dumb joke, so don’t feel too bad. I might be a world-renowned performer,” I say, winking, “but even I have my off days.” I recompose myself. “Jayko, I look forward to our partnership. As a show of good faith, I’d like to offer my assistance to you. If there is something that I can help you with that would allow you to focus on bringing back Rook with me, I would love to offer my services.”
“You mentioned making weapons, yes?”
Jayko 12-Oct-18 02:04 PM
"liquid weapons, this one will journey for ingredients with the doctor of buff to make more sleep poison"
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 02:05 PM
“Oh, ok! Do you know any details yet, or are you and Buff going to be figuring that out soon?”
Jayko 12-Oct-18 02:06 PM
"I am thinking it is today, it is hard to judge without sun"
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 02:08 PM
“Ah yes, that would make it difficult,” I say smiling. “Well, if you have room for one more, I would be happy to help.” I look toward the door then back at Jayko. “Is there anything you’d like to talk about before I leave? I still need to talk to one more person, but I have some time.” (edited)
Jayko 12-Oct-18 02:12 PM
Jayko ponders for a moment, mindlessly grabbing a fish from the bucket and cracking it then swallowing it whole "Jayko is not so sure... But he will need shop for base to poisons later... We ask professor of the buff later"
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 02:16 PM
I nod. “Sounds good. Well, if you have any more questions or concerns, you can find me in my room, or the Abbey, or at the Barded Larder, a tavern at which I perform. The first step of bringing back Rook requires getting information from a particular gentleman...but we can talk more on that later.” (edited)
I make my way to the door and stop. “..I truly believe we can change the world,” I say somewhat more serious than I’ve been. I shake myself out of the deep thought. “..and with you, Jayko, I think our chances got a lot higher.” With a final smile, I disappear down the hallway. (edited)
Jayko 12-Oct-18 02:22 PM
Jayko attempts to smile like you do but the frog perceives it as aggression and begins fighting Jayko for a fish from the bucket
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 04:14 PM
Making her way further down the hall, Cass comes to the door. She takes a deep breath, exhales, and straightens up, before knocking deliberately on Buff’s door.
Professor Buff Orpington 12-Oct-18 04:50 PM
The door slowly slides open. Inside you see a desk dragged to the middle of the room with a beholder dangling on top. The skin has been peeled back and its organs are exposed. Next to it, on the floor, is the other beholder, while laying on the bed is an incapacitated golden grung with little scratch marks and evidence of dissection littering its tiny, breathing body. Towering above this rudimentary dissection table is the Professor, stripped down to his briefs and covered in the beholder’s blood. His face is focused and clearly exhausted as he works deliberately. His hands, despite their massive size, grasp tiny, metal tools, moving quickly and gently over the body of the beholder, like the gentle caress of a lover. He is frustrated at his progress and even more so at the “laboratory” he has been forced to occupy. He pauses when he notices you, his hands freeze, and he looks at you with a mixture of annoyance and expectance. (edited)
Cass Allura 12-Oct-18 08:44 PM
It’s hard to hide my shock and disgust, but I do my best. “Professor,” I say with a measured tone. “When you have a moment, I’d like to speak with you.”
“..you’re clearly busy. I’ll be in the common area. I have a development that I believe you’ll find...’fascinating.’” I walk away.
Professor Buff Orpington 12-Oct-18 08:58 PM
“Please.” I call out before you get too far. I drop my tools and make a few last minute scribbles in my notebook. “Any unscheduled visit is an interruption of my genius. The damage has already been done, so please, come back in and say what you have to say or leave me to my work.”
Cass Allura 13-Oct-18 03:02 AM
Sigh. I walk back to the doorway, staring you in the eyes. “There’s a way to bring Rook back.”
Professor Buff Orpington 13-Oct-18 04:34 AM
The Professor looks at you intrigued and inquisitive for what feels like an eternity before returning to his work, a touch slower as he begins speaking. “That would be quite ideal. Upon Rook’s passing my feelings were mixed. Initially I felt a feeling we Goliaths, or perhaps just we Orpotanu-Laga feel surrounding death: ... that a healthy culling is essential to the maintenance of any healthy population. Purging the weak truly allows the strong to flourish.” He stops and allows himself to admire the product of his work: a newly excavated organ, holding it closely to his face and squinting before setting it down and rapidly sketching it. “However, I will admit the disintegration of my - ... dear friend, Rook had me quite irritated. As what essentially amounts to the leading evolutionary biology in Creissos, I understand how cruel and random a role chance can play in our development. Often the strongest find themselves defeated by factors outside of their control, like a sudden change in environment. It seems unjust and chaotic but that just makes it all the more-...” He looks up and forces something close to a smile upon his face. “I often ramble when I get excited, an unfortunate side effect of possessing a gifted mind. Tell me, what do you need me to do?” (edited)
Cass Allura 13-Oct-18 10:16 AM
I stare at Buff for several seconds, picking my words carefully after weighing his response. “Professor...I need to know that I can rely on you. Bringing back Rook will not be easy, but with your help, I know we can do it. However, this falls apart without a somewhat mutual dependency.” “I know you think I’m naïve, and perhaps I am to some extent. But know that my anger at Locke and Jayko and you was born out of a similar frustration that you experienced. It was unjust. It was chaotic. And we can make it right.” I look down for a moment, composing myself, before looking up at Buff with confident, cold eyes. “We don’t have to agree with each other, but for this task we need to be able to trust each other. We need to both be willing to fight for someone else. Can you fight for us?” I hold out my hand, aware of the gore on Buff’s hands. “Can you fight for Rook?”
Professor Buff Orpington 13-Oct-18 11:22 AM
I think for a second before cleaning my hands on a nearby rag. I slowly approach you and extend my hand, pulling it back just before it reaches your own “Cass, I see the disgust and anger in your eyes, though I do not mind it. I have elicited many such looks since my migration south. There are fundamental things you may never understand about me because of the world I was born into, but understanding is not necessary for our cooperation. Before I agree, I have a demand and a request for you. Which would you like to hear first?”
Cass Allura 13-Oct-18 01:09 PM
I pull my hand back in hesitation. “..what is your demand?”
Professor Buff Orpington 13-Oct-18 01:26 PM
“It is really nothing. I just ask that when the time comes, assuming there is no divine or other intervention, and Rook once again passes, his body is unconditionally granted to me. No rites, no tokens, no-“ I look directly at you. “Self-righteous grandstanding. I- we, the scientific community, Bluecliff, Creissos, cannot risk to lose the technology he represents, for the sake of progress and the common good.” (edited)
Cass Allura 13-Oct-18 01:42 PM
I lower my hand and stare at Buff. “..what is your request.”
Professor Buff Orpington 13-Oct-18 02:01 PM
“This is voluntary, but my gratitude would be immeasurable. And the gratitude of the brightest mind in Creissos is surely a valuable commodity. I will admit that I may have underestimated the value of the Classics during my time at the Bluecliff Academy. So I am not as learned as I could be when it comes to characters like Cassandra.” I eye you expecting to have elicited some kind of reaction. “Cassandra specifically is of little interest to me, it is Mathandror I wish to know more about. My studies focus on the development and evolution of ancient magical creatures, specifically dragons, even more specifically the archaeowyrm, which I can expand upon at a later date. What you need to know is it was, or perhaps is, ancient, gigantic, formidable, and uncorroborated, much like Mathandror. I would like information, perhaps identification of a subject matter expert, and to visit the site of Mathandror’s defeat. Do not feel the need to immediately make a decision on this request.” (edited)
Cass Allura 13-Oct-18 02:16 PM
[Can you make an insight check if you’re trying to gauge a reaction?]
Cass Allura 13-Oct-18 03:09 PM
I stare back at you, an unreadable expression on my face. “Your demand asks something of me that I cannot give. I have no ownership of Rook. If you want Rook’s body after he dies, you take it up with him. If he agrees, I will of course honor his wishes.”
“As for your request...” I look at you with a steadiness and finality that may seem unfamiliar on my face. “..I can oblige you. In that sense, our goals may coincide. I, too, wish to return to the site of Mathandror’s demise.” “I cannot, however, guarantee that it will be anytime soon. We were fools to rush into Marshwreath unprepared.” I continue, not waiting for a rebuttal. “If we had, Rook would still be alive.”
“Are we in agreement, Professor?” I raise out my hand.
Professor Buff Orpington 13-Oct-18 04:06 PM
“We are, Cass.” And I extend my hand to meet yours. My grasp is limp and quick. “I look forward to our partnership. You may prove to have your uses after all.” And I begin dissecting the beholder once again, alternating between cuts and scribbles. It seems a goodbye was implied.
Cass Allura 13-Oct-18 04:32 PM
Scowling at your back, I begin to leave. Before exiting, I hesitate. Then, quietly: “You may have your uses as well, Buff.” I leave. (edited)
Loralith 17-Oct-18 01:03 PM
As Cass leaves, she soon hears quick footsteps coming up behind her. Loralith soon catches up to her and walks beside her. "Hey, I don't know if we've ever been properly introduced. I'm Loralith." She offers her hand
Cass Allura 17-Oct-18 04:37 PM
[What does Cass see when she looks at Loralith? I don’t believe I know what you look like officially.]
Loralith 17-Oct-18 08:31 PM
Loralith is a Drow woman. She has dark skin but not as dark as Drow are generally depicted. Her hair is white, loose, and neck-length. She is taller than most women and has a muscular build. She wears casual loose clothing with generally dark tones. (edited)
Cass Allura 18-Oct-18 10:10 AM
I look up to you, my scowl quickly fading into surprise. “Oh! Hello!” I shake your hand. “It’s a pleasure to meet you, Loralith! My name is Cass,” I say, as I flash my most winning smile.
Loralith 18-Oct-18 11:12 AM
Loralith mirrors your smile "The pleasure is mine, Cass." She pauses for a moment, quickly changing to a more serious tone. "Is everything alright?" (edited)
Cass Allura 18-Oct-18 11:15 AM
My hand pauses on the handle to my room. My smile falters for a moment as I stare back at you. “What...what makes you say that?”
Jayko 18-Oct-18 11:35 AM

Loralith 18-Oct-18 12:13 PM

Cass Allura 18-Oct-18 12:25 PM

Loralith 18-Oct-18 12:36 PM

Cass Allura 18-Oct-18 12:41 PM
I look at you for a moment, a little taken aback by this offer. “Um...I uh...yeah. Actually, yeah, thank you, that would be great. Do you...do you have a few minutes?”
Loralith 18-Oct-18 12:48 PM
Loralith smiles again "Of course. What's on your mind?"
Cass Allura 18-Oct-18 01:27 PM
I open the door to my room, gesturing inside. “If you’re comfortable talking in here, we can do so. If not, out here should be fine.” I look down the empty hallway, making sure no one is around. (edited)
Loralith 18-Oct-18 01:47 PM
"This should be fine" Loralith slips past you and into the room
Cass Allura 18-Oct-18 02:00 PM
I close the door behind us. My room is...interesting. It has a bed with dark blue sheets, with a large wooden chest open at the foot of it. Inside, you see a large gleaming warhammer. There is a nearby desk and chair, with a drum, viol, and lyre leaning against it by the corner. The desk is covered in papers. In fact, you will see many papers on the floor, somewhat haphazardly strewn. On the desk, you also see something framed, what appears to be hair, with some writing beneath it. On the walls are pictures, drawings that denote various forms of skill. There are childish drawings, one of a dark skinned girl with wild hair brandishing a sword over the corpse of a dragon with “x”’s in its eyes. The most notable object is the large painting on the center wall. It is of a dark skinned human woman with long braided hair, clad in gold and bronze armor as she hefts a long sword over her shoulder. She is beautiful and powerful. (edited)
Loralith 18-Oct-18 03:03 PM
Loralith casually peruses the objects in the room, carefully avoiding any papers on the floor if possible. She pays particular attention to the framed object on the desk and attempts to read the writing.
Cass Allura 18-Oct-18 09:31 PM
“Sorry about the mess,” I say, smiling sheepishly. “I’ve had a pretty crazy couple of days.” I start to pick up the papers when I notice you looking at the framed object. “Oh, that!” I laugh. “It’s a...it’s a trinket from home.” I walk over to your side and show it to you. “It’s a lock of my mom’s hair. I know that seems weird,” I say quickly, eyeing you somewhat nervously, “but...she wanted to give it to me as a reminder that, no matter how far away I am, I’ll always have a piece of home by my side.” (edited)
“She also wrote a little something she used to say to me growing up.” Looking at the cursive text, you read: “To Cass, the next great heroine of Irs.” (edited)
“I know it’s a little silly, but it’s grown on me. I’d be so bold to say it even...well, inspires me.” Smiling, I set down the frame and lean my back against the desk chair, staring at you. “Alright, I’ve told you a bit about me. Your turn,” I say, smiling warmly. (edited)
Loralith 18-Oct-18 09:52 PM
"Well, I definitely understand needing to be reminded of home. My home is so different from Bluecliff..." Loralith stares off into space for a moment "Anyway, I've traveled the world pretty heavily. I've seen and done things that most people wouldn't dare to dream. I've never really put down roots because when you're an adventurer it's best not to have attachments. But making friends here and there never hurts. You never know who might save your life." (edited)
Cass Allura 19-Oct-18 01:25 AM
My smiles fades slightly. “Yeah, that sounds rough. My friend was killed by a Beholder yesterday, and I almost joined him, so I can sort of relate.”
Loralith 19-Oct-18 09:02 AM

Cass Allura 19-Oct-18 10:52 AM
Seeing your reaction, I sigh. “..sorry. I don’t mean to be rude, I’m just a little on edge. I’ve....I’m a little guarded, if I’m being honest. You seem really nice, and I want to get to know you more, it’s just...” I struggle to find the words. “..you’re a relative stranger who immediately wants to help me out. A week ago, that wouldn’t have phased me. But it’s like you said, I’ve seen and done things that have really changed my perspective. It’s nothing against you, I think I’m just defensive right now.” I plop down on my bed. “..to be honest, a friend sounds pretty nice right now,” I say, laughing. You can hear how tired I am.
Loralith 19-Oct-18 11:38 AM
"Is that what the argument was about earlier? Your friend? I've lost plenty of friends over the years. I guess I've learned to accept it as an inevitability. It's dark, I know, but sometimes the world is darker than we realize and it's better to be prepared for it than to let it sneak up on you. Even so, usually there is something to be done. Is there any way to help your friend? ... Or to avenge him?" (edited)
Cass Allura 19-Oct-18 11:49 AM
My face falls noticeably. “Yeah, that’s the general ‘advice’ I’ve been getting. Look, I get that people die. I just....I never want to become as callous and heartless as...” I glance at my door. “..as some people.” I stand up, walking to the chest at the foot of my bed. “That’s why I’m going to bring him back,” I say, taking out Rook’s warhammer. (edited)
“See, Rook died because we weren’t prepared. It could have been any of us that died yesterday. It wasn’t fair, it wasn’t natural, and I refuse to accept it. Rook shouldn’t have to stay dead because we were fools.” (edited)
“So I did some investigating and found a few leads. With this, I think—“ I stop, and look closely at you.
“Loralith. You want to make a friend, be that for purely advantageous reasons or not, I won’t fault you for either. My mission may take me as far as the Throne. I don’t know what reward awaits us at the end, but I imagine we’ll find plenty to do here and in that massive city that will be well-worth the travel. Would you be interested in helping me bring back Rook?” (edited)

Professor Buff Orpington 19-Oct-18 03:07 PM
This has been an interesting few days. I encountered and read a book by Lord Hastor Iarneth. It was undeveloped with some weak theses but proved to have an impressive knowledge of hunting patterns and births. Despite his absence he is a force that continues to linger in my life. Truth be told, during my trip to Em Yanthan my mind was occupied with that man’s face. While Jayko and his pet harvested reagents I reacquainted myself with Professor Regina Tinkerton and some of her colleagues. She gave me some constructive advice, I should accumulate wealth and utilize my new freedom to drive forward scientific progress. Seeing the rigid academics discussing their hollow theories reaffirmed this advice. I will correspond with her in the near future. I attended the lecture out of respect for Professor Tinkerton but it ended up providing some useful information. Anthropology is a weak science, especially when compared to biology, anatomy, and even alchemy, but a moment of enlightenment will every once in a while escape the mouth of an anthropology professor. The elves of Wran Delenor hold technology that will move Creissos forward and I will assist in unlocking it. These anthropologists will need an academic with a mind for analysis when the time comes. Even among all these fascinating discoveries and academics Professor Monromi stands out as the most fascinating creature. Despite her interesting physical features and arcane origins, it is our shared will and vision that draws me to her. I very much hope to collaborate with her in the future. I will have to come to a decision soon. I need allies in the Bluecliff Adventurer’s Guild but Jayko alone has proven to possess the will and inquisitive orientation necessary for an effective partnership. I will not compromise on my research or on the need to drive scientific progress forward, but in the coming battle I will need these simple adventurers, even if they lack my academic pedigree. (edited)
Jayko 22-Oct-18 11:13 PM
Jayko the last few days has been in and out of his room with the door closed tight or at the work bench tinkering with what appears to be a small piece of wood. Lizard claws on wood and metal you hear Jayko muttering and swearing in Deep Speech as he slowly but surely makes progress. After a (few) day(s) DM HALP Jayko seems to be out in the open throwing bone darts at the dart board with RUTGA and is not wearing his cloak (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 23-Oct-18 01:47 PM
Day 2 after Marshwreath, in the evening. Buff returns to his room after an emotionally draining day attending lectures in Em Yanthan. He places his newly acquired possessions, a small, dark vial and a fresh looking, and smelling, book, on his bed. Looking around the room he sees a deplorable mess. Despite now lacking two bloody specimens, the evidence of his work has painted his room a dark red. He quickly sets about tidying and cleaning his room, until it looks somewhere close to normal. Lugging the heavy, bloody rags out of his room, he brings them outside and dumps them into a container on the street. On his way back to his room, he eyes Cass, seemingly readying herself to depart. Before she sees him, he scurries back to his room and eases the door shut, but something on his bed catches his eye. "Dragons and Wyrms by Lord Hastor Iarneth." Buff pauses, thinks for a second, and grits his teeth, before reopening his door and heading back into the hallway. Intentionally or otherwise, Professor Buff Orpington is now blocking Cass' path out of the guild. "Good evening, Cass. I find myself in the unfortunate position of needing the help of an inferior-..." He recognizes his poor choice of words and quickly clarifies. "I need information from a certain individual, said inferior, who frequents an establishment in the Merchant's Quarter. He possesses information of both an academic and personal nature to me. I need it. I believe I lack the necessary charm to obtain that information, as does my first choice for a companion, Jayko. Thus I turn to you for help in this matter. I would readily pay you for diplomatic services rendered." (edited)
Cass Allura 23-Oct-18 04:01 PM
I’m dressed in finer clothes, with deep blues and dark purple accents. I’m carrying several of my instruments on my back, with a bound stack of journals and loose papers under one arm. I stare at you for several moments, a skeptical look on my face. I sigh.
“..what is it you need my help with, Professor?”
My tone is cordial and not necessarily rude. I am being respectful—trying to, at least.
Professor Buff Orpington 23-Oct-18 04:31 PM
"I will keep this short. We both have our respective duties to attend to. I have come into possession of a piece of intelligence pertaining to the archaeowyrm, the focus of my research. In addition, this man has supposedly been quite-... vocal when it comes to certain aspects of my personal life that I would benefit from keeping quiet. This man is Velec Tesovo, a regular patron of the Grinning Rat in the Merchant's Quarter. The information he holds seems to be too good to be true, and I have made enemies throughout my career- a truth I'm sure you would find astonishing." He shoots you a glance and a pause, which you imply to mean he is telling a joke. "Thus I suspect a trap. The trap is of no concern to me. I am physically capable and possess an astute acumen, giving me an advantage in all physical engagements. I would ask you to accompany me and utilize your subtlety to extract the information on the archaeowyrm and my past. I have my own methods if subtlety does not suffice. As stated, I have the means to reward you for your assistance." (edited)
Cass Allura 23-Oct-18 08:05 PM
My eyes go wide. “Velec? Who told you about this person? What else did they say?” (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 23-Oct-18 08:19 PM
“A close colleague from my time at the Bluecliff Academy is aware of my acute fascination with the archaeowyrm. She shared the information with me as a professional courtesy. Her word is to be as trusted as my own.” He pauses and seems to recycle your words through his head. “You speak as though this man is familiar to you.”
Cass Allura 23-Oct-18 08:37 PM
“As familiar to me as he is to you.” I place my armload on the ground, cross my legs and arms, and lean against the wall. “I was told he was a person who knew things—specifically, in relation to bringing Rook back.” (edited)
“Velec is the first person of interest on my list. I’ve heard he’s a bit ‘bristly,’ so I thought it wise to bring some muscle.” I raise my eyebrows and slightly nod my head toward you.
Professor Buff Orpington 23-Oct-18 09:08 PM
Buff takes his time processing your words. “This seems-... too good to be true. Providing perfect bait for each of us: a path to resurrecting Rook for you, progress on my life’s work for me...” And as it dawns in him, for the first time you see Buff smile. It’s rough and forced, like he’s using a newly discovered muscle, but it’s unmistakable. “Ah. Brilliant. Perhaps I underestimated this Velec and Professor Tinkerton’s warnings of danger. Even if this Velec Tesovo lacks the answers to our questions he will certainly have information of use.”
“If there is anyone qualified to spring his trap it is me, and I will do so, though your words will be of use to me in this next fight.”
Cass Allura 23-Oct-18 09:31 PM
I stand up straight. “Whoa whoa whoa, slow down, Professor. If we play our cards right, maybe we don’t have to ‘fight’ at all.”
Professor Buff Orpington 23-Oct-18 10:11 PM
“Hm. Perhaps I should leave my weapons at the guild then.” For the first time in this unusually cordial conversation he gives you his typical blank, cutting expression. “I do not mean to be harsh, perhaps part of it is a gentle touch lost in translation, perhaps not. The stakes are such that I will prepare for this next-... encounter ... as if I am setting off to meet the archaeowyrm itself. After the regrettable events of Marshwreath and even before, akrasia is the one vice I cannot stomach. Though I am depending on your diplomacy I need to know I can depend on you to shift strategies at a moment’s notice.” (edited)
Cass Allura 24-Oct-18 12:20 AM
“Of course. I am not pretending that everything will go according to my plan. As you said, after the events of Marshwreath and even before, we must be ready for any eventuality.” I adjust the lute on my back. “I think we should try the diplomatic route first. It would be efficient, yeah?” I say, looking at you pointedly. “However, the moment things begin to turn out of our favor, we will enact...contingencies. Specifically, our mutual alchemist and reclusive monk.” (edited)
Cass Allura 24-Oct-18 12:29 AM
“Professor, my top priority is getting information on resurrecting Rook, and you are to help in that endeavor, as we’ve established with your...terms.” “..however, I will make your reasons for meeting Velec a priority as well.” My expression softens for a moment. “Your research is very important to you. I can understand that. Your past is something you’d rather keep out of the public eye. I can also understand that; we all have things we’re hiding.” My stare takes on a similar aspect to Buff’s: a resolute, final, and stony gaze. “I understand many things, and some part of me believes that, in time, you will learn to believe me. Until that day, I just ask that you trust me.”
Professor Buff Orpington 24-Oct-18 10:26 AM
“Ah, yes. Jayko I can depend on, if he leaves his grung at the guild. If this is a trap we will have to move deliberately and I cannot risk my information for his pet. As for the Drow woman... she has not yet proven herself to be of use to me other than her unique biology. If you can vouch for her discipline and prowess I will permit her to accompany me.” He takes a step closer. “Though as you said, the information this man claims to hold is my foremost priority. If this untested monk causes us failure... I will call upon you when I am ready to depart. I have work that needs attending to at this moment and so, I presume, do you.” Buff moves back towards his room. (edited)
Cass Allura 24-Oct-18 03:50 PM
“Of course,” I say, picking up my bundle of journals and papers. “I have some ideas, as I’m sure you do as well, so we can discuss that later.” “Have a good night, Professor,” I say, waving my hand over my shoulder as I walk down the hallway. Humming a tune, I exit the guild.
Jayko 29-Oct-18 11:08 AM

Cass Allura 29-Oct-18 04:59 PM
Walking into my room after arriving back to the guild, I close my door quietly. After a moment, I sigh tiredly, leaning against the door as the tension and stress of the evening begins to hit. “I can’t believe that worked.” I rub my hands on my face. Well, as well as it could have worked, I suppose, I think to myself. I tried to play it careful this time, and I think that was the right choice—I just hope Velec isn’t angry or even hostile to us because of it. I sit in my thoughts for a moment, replaying the events of the night. I have to admit, though...it really did feel like we were acting as a team. Jayko and Loralith were as silent as the night, and even the Professor trusted me with the talking, which I’m sure was a big thing for him. I furrow my brow. If we’re lucky, tomorrow will go well without too much incident. Of course, I wouldn’t say I’ve been very lucky since arriving here, but... Opening my eyes, I stare at my painting of Cassandra. She looks so calm, so confident. “Resolute in shining armor.” I shake my head and walk to the chest at the foot of my bed. Withdrawing Rook’s war hammer from the trunk, I pull out a cloth and begin methodically wiping it down as I think. We’re getting close. We’re getting so close. I once again see that glimpse of Rook falling away from me, slipping out of sight as I reach desperately for his hand. I close my eyes and will the image out of my head. “Hold on, Rook. We’re on our way.” (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 29-Oct-18 05:54 PM
Cass earlier spoke of an organization called “Starcross” who seeks to bring balance to Creissos, toppling powerful institutions. Their methods do not bother me, but their mission speaks to the same moral crisis in Creissos: a fear of power and fear of those with the will to seize it. Power brings order; Order brings prosperity; Prosperity brings progress. Perhaps my academic downfall was orchestrated by that same group. Cass performed adequately. Her role was a bit too exotic and underdeveloped to be believable but she reacted well to pressure. If the circumstances call for diplomacy in the future, I may allow myself to depend on her, though perhaps I should review her role beforehand. Jayko was present. Loralith was also present and has yet to earn my trust, but showed some tactical awareness. She must be tested in the future. Velec revealed himself to me, as I expected. He seems to hold the knowledge I need but requests my assistance to escort him to the Throne. A fair bargain. With my past and future dangled before me it will take all my focus and will to remain in the present. (edited)

1
Cass Allura 03-Nov-18 11:49 AM
We have to find Rook’s soul in the middle of a desert run by an undead king. “..well that sounds difficult.” Locke’s words hit my tired ears, the understatement of the epoch. ... Despite a momentary separation, the journey to the Throne with Velec and friends went without incident, thankfully. Locke wasn’t kidding; the city is breathtaking. The denizens themselves (the non-hulking metal ones, at least) seemed more focused on function than fashion, which is why I was delighted to happen across a fellow performer busking on the street! We traded in the only currency worth anything to folks in our field: stories. I even had an opportunity to debut my (hopefully someday) defining work, “Cassandra.” The gentleman seemed to greatly enjoy it, which brought me some much needed joy after the stressful week I’ve had. Gods, it’s really only been a week, hasn’t it? Of course, no one in my party seemed particularly interested in my work. I suppose at this point I should be used to it; no one finds me useful beyond a being mouthpiece in only specific situations. Still...if I’m being honest, it does kind of bother me. I know, it’s childish—after all, we have so many more important things going on. I can’t help how I feel, though. I’m trying my best to form some connections with people here, in whatever way that means. I guess just add it to my list of failures. .....sigh...I don’t mean that. I...I know I’m worthwhile. I just...it’s been hard recently. ..anyway. We learned from Nebula that Rook is far older than I ever imagined, and that he may awake in the Agumohz Desert. A desert, mind you, that is controlled by an Undead King that was created by an ancient super weapon so powerful that it changed the landscape forever. So that’s fun. (edited)
1
We learned more information, including a genuinely surprising bit about Buff’s “archaeowyrm”—of course, I know it by a different name. I guess Bulwark will have to answer questions from the two of us. I can’t wait for that conversation. Ugh. (edited)
..I do feel for Loralith. Something terrible happened to her people, from the cryptic conversation she had with Nebula. Something that the Throne itself regrets. I don’t know what she went through, but I know what pain looks like. She may be a stranger, and hundreds (?) of years old, but maybe I can offer to listen to her. She’ll probably say no, understandably, but....well, she needs to know the option is available. No one should ever feel alone. ..did you hear that, Cass? (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 03-Nov-18 01:24 PM
My mind is occupied with my archaeowyrm. The ties to Mathandror seem perhaps even greater than I thought. Bulwark will tell me more. As will Velec. Rook seems to be of more urgent value than I thought. Ancient, with valuable knowledge and technology resting somewhere in that untapped mind. The Firmament is also worth investigating. Such technology would be of enormous value. Loralith reacted interestingly to the Throne. As I recall from my classes on Creissos lore, her people (or even herself depending on the date) was involved in an elven kinslaying. We Goliath do not pay much heed to history. The only history that influences my life is the tattoos covering me. If I met Thalai Kincrusher herself I would leave her unscathed in the shared knowledge that the constant equilibrium of self- and clan-survival is paramount. The Throne was in every way a symbol of this great continent of Creissos: an ostentatious and outdated monument to unearned national prestige, housing an immortal god-king possessing nigh unlimited power opting to stay neutral in every situation except those involving his bloated, corrupt, incompetent bureaucrats, while mercenaries, adventurers, and criminals serve as the true political authority. But perhaps the corpses in Marshwreath would be happy to know the priesthood made their absent king a god. (edited)
1
Cass Allura 05-Nov-18 07:10 PM
I walk to Loralith’s door. Hesitating for a moment, I pull out a sealed envelope, slip it under her door, then quickly make my way back to my room.
Loralith 07-Nov-18 10:24 AM
Loralith arrives back to the Adventurers Guild after being gone most of the day. As she opens the door to her room, an envelope on the floor catches her eye. She picks it up and eyes it quizzically. Envelope in hand, Loralith closes the door and places her belongings to the side. She calmly walks over to her bed and sits down. She peels open the envelope and examines the contents...
Cass Allura 07-Nov-18 12:32 PM
Loralith, I truly appreciate all the help you’ve provided me in our attempt to resurrect Rook. From insuring a tactical advantage when meeting Velec, to guiding us to the Priesthood, you have been indispensable. For that, I thank you. What happened in the Throne, what happened with Nebula... ..I’m not going to pretend to have any idea what you’re dealing with, nor will I foolishly attempt to offer advice for something I don’t understand. You are several dozens hundreds many years older than me, and—by your own admission—have experienced many things, both terrific and tragic. I don’t know what you’ve gone through, but I am smart enough to recognize pain. Therefore, I offer the only thing I can: a person who will listen. If you want to vent, explain, emote, whatever, I will be there for you. It is the least I can do. If you don’t want any of this, disregard this letter. Nothing will change between us, and I will not bring it up unless you do first. I just want you to know that, despite how you may feel, you are not completely alone. There is at least one half-elf firebrand who will lend you her ear. In time, I imagine you will find more. All the best, Cass (the next great heroine of Irs) (edited)

Professor Buff Orpington 08-Nov-18 12:38 PM
I saw it today. In my snowy, barren home I saw my archaeowyrm once again. It is called Tyrioc. It is power manifest and my vindication. The priest says I must confront my past before I can see it again, so I will do so. But Rook’s links to the past cannot be ignored either. Much to consider. The Church of Iùn has proven to be unnecessarily deceptive. My research today seems to suggest a systematic cover up of the history surrounding the Drow elves by the Church and the Throne. Every action they take is to insulate themselves from accountability. Perhaps Loralith and I have aligned interests after all. Velec must be taken care of. Cass frequents taverns and likely has unsavory connections that can resolve the Velec dilemma while he is in prison.
1
Professor Buff Orpington 08-Nov-18 03:15 PM
I carefully preserve the eyestalks Jayko gave to me, but before I begin my analysis, I tear out two pieces of paper, writing diligently. I slide one note under the door of Loralith and one under the door of Cass. I return to my room and close the door.
Cass Allura 08-Nov-18 06:22 PM
Today was....a lot. That’s been a recent trend. Bringing the Professor to the Abbey went easier than expected. I was happy to see Buff acting cordial around the temple—with only a hint of superiority. Then we saw his archaeowyrm, the hitherto Nameless White Dragon, given a title by Bulwark: Tyrioc. Gods, the sheer immensity of it is almost beyond comprehension. Buff’s behavior was almost as surprising: he was joyful, borderline euphoric. His obsession with this Ancient is as frightening as it is familiar. Afterwards, Bulwark presented me with the next piece of the Rook puzzle—well...I should try not think about it. I made a promise, after all. All I can say is, when we find Rook’s soul, I will know what to do next. Hopefully it doesn’t kill me in the process. (edited)
Oh. And of course, a day in the life of Cass wouldn’t be complete if I didn’t get my ass kicked for no reason whatsoever. Leaving the Abbey, we saw some people rushing down the street to witness a brawl. This piqued my interest, so Buff and I headed over. It wasn’t until we approached the crowd that I recognized the Grinning Rat. Hoping to get a better view, I disguised myself as one of the several guards on the scene and pushed my way through the crowd. What I saw was certainly a sight to behold. On the ground lied a man, clearly bested by his assailant—an elven man we know all too well, unfortunately. Velec stood at the entrance of the bar, holding a glowing wand, claiming that the man on the ground, “Jaren,” had crossed him one too many times. A guard tells Velec to put down the wand. Seems reasonable, yeah? Wrong. Instead, Velec scans the crowd, looks right at me in my disguise, smiles horribly—and fires three bolts at my chest. Unable to get my spells off in time, I take three horrible hits and fall on my back. As I lie there, dazed, I see a group of people approach Velec. Not guards or common folk, but with weapons and armor. Other adventurers? Something about their blonde member struck a chord with me. In my dazed state, I swear he was the spitting image of that woman I met at the Abbey.
1
I quickly made my way out of there, dropped my disguise and fled down an alley with Buff, just in time to see Velec led away by guards, with no sign of this Jaren fellow or that group. I expected shitty commentary from Buff for my actions, but something was strange about his words. It seemed like he was trying to deceive me—telling me things that I knew to be true, and yet...like he was lying to me. After the day I had, it infuriated me at first, before he made a comment about how I speak so many words and make so little sense. There was something in his deceptive voice that made it clear—this was Buff’s way of complimenting me. He meant the opposite of what he said, but his pride wouldn’t allow for vulnerability. Smiling, I made my way back to the guild with him, nursing my unearned wounds. Professor Buff Orpington, you are a mystery I hope to solve one day. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . (edited)
Finishing my introspection and still carefully patting the now bruising hits from earlier, I notice a slip of paper underneath my door. Oh! Maybe Loralith will take me up on that offer after all! I quickly pick it up and examine it. (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 08-Nov-18 06:41 PM
The note reads: “Cass, This is a matter of some urgency. Do not speak to me directly. I have written my message to you using a fairly simple cipher. The code word is a word only you and I know to describe that which I have spent my life hunting. I cannot risk speaking these words out loud or even putting them in writing. PCRZSKGBRVUGKUVSBRPRFWAWVFMMZGVKLAHDXIZTZGW -Professor Buff Orpington” (edited)

Cass Allura 09-Nov-18 01:37 AM

My mind racing, I quickly pull out a journal, tear out a piece of paper, and scrawl something on it. Walking quietly to Buff’s room, I glance at my message one final time before slipping it beneath his door and promptly returning to my room. Professor BBFVHMBJCEWVAMLBWPYM Cass (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 09-Nov-18 10:12 AM
Buff retrieves the note, deciphers it in a few seconds, and looks down at it visibly annoyed. He flips over the same note and carves his next message deep into the note. He rushes back to Cass’ room and roughly pushes his note under her door and returns to his room. Cass. NO TIME FOR CONVERSATION. PFRQWPYMYMOVMYTSGJXRYZSCMCEA Prof.
Cass Allura 09-Nov-18 10:38 AM
I was ready for the note as it slid under the door. Reading through the pattern, I scowl, tear out some more paper, write quickly, and make my way to Buff’s room. I slide the note under his door.
Professor Buff Orpington 09-Nov-18 10:48 AM
I leap out of my seat and hurry towards the note on the floor. I pick it up and examine it. Reading its contents I let out a curse in Jotun. I retrieve a fresh sheet of paper and furiously scribble a new note. I whip open my door to find myself face to face with Cass. Before she has a chance to speak I pull her into my room and slam the door. “I have no time for these games. What are you doing?”
Cass Allura 09-Nov-18 10:54 AM
“What am I doing? What are you doing!” I say in a furious whisper. “You’re asking me to do something incredibly extreme with no proof of actual imminent danger. Are you asking me to just trust you?”
My eyes spark with an idea, and I hold up a hand to stop you from responding.
“What is the rarest spoken language you know? The least known by people?”
Professor Buff Orpington 09-Nov-18 11:01 AM
“Likely my native tongue, Jotun.”
Cass Allura 09-Nov-18 11:02 AM
“Speak only in that language to me, and write in a language that is equally rare and difficult.” As I say that, I mutter a few arcane words, twist my hands into several different shapes, and a faint pulse is felt rippling through my body, its power settling in my senses.
“Resume your response in Jotun.”
I hear a sudden deep rumbling beneath my feet. It disappears a moment later. “..wait. What was that? Did you hear that?”
Professor Buff Orpington 09-Nov-18 11:35 AM
@RalphusAdolphus this is your letter: “Loralith, I have spent the day learning of the incidents of your people. I hope you understand there is no intentional cruelty or malice in my words. The events of your history are very unfortunate, and though I cannot understand this Creissos obsession with historical wrongs, the pain you and your people feel towards the Throne is well grounded. I would like to interview you at some point to identify differences and contradictions in the two accounts. Whatever quest for justice you have is your own and I will not interfere. This incident is part of a long history of inaction and self-preservation by the Throne, and the lack of publicly accessible historical record speaks to an unwillingness to accept their actions and likely a systematic cover up. I will not go so far as to explicitly say I will actively assist you in a campaign against the Throne, but I simply inform you that our interests align. -Professor Buff Orpington”
1
Loralith 09-Nov-18 11:56 AM
Loralith had spent the day in her room contemplating her next actions. The journey ahead, when it comes, will be quite a new challenge. It has been a while... Though lost in thought, she did notice the heavy footfalls approach her door and a message slide under it. There were few other suspects than the large professor. Loralith felt no urgency in reading his message but eventually found her way to it. Her response to the message is initially annoyance. This changed to cynicism and by the end she fails to hold down a scoff and an eye roll as she crumples the message and tosses it across the room to the waste bin by the desk. The professor and her "interests" may "align" for now, but she has no intention of agreeing to an interview regarding her people and their history or discussing the crimes systematically conducted by the Throne over that history. The professor and her alliance is purely circumstantial. Perhaps it is his emotional detachment from everything or his scientific inquiries or just the way he speaks but Loralith cannot help but be reminded of the denizens of the Throne each time they interact. It will be an ordeal to keep herself from acting on this. As Loralith crosses the room to ensure the message landed in the bin where it belonged, she can see it lightly vibrating against the tin walls. Suddenly she hears a loud rumbling underfoot followed by Locke approaching Buff's room. She can hear half of the conversation but it appears there may have been some sort of explosion... Loralith opens her door to see what is going on.

Cass Allura 09-Nov-18 07:50 PM
Closing my door behind me, I fall backwards onto my bed. Physically and emotionally sore, I try to make sense of these recent events, the situations and circumstances flashing through my head as I start to drift asleep. Velec, smiling widely upon recognizing me, firing three magic missiles at my chest. Buff, paranoid and worried about the elf in a way I have never seen. The journey to the Throne, information for us and a "friend" for Velec. Those eyes of his shining an unnatural blue. I shiver at the memory. Come on, Cass, think of something pleasant for once. You've earned that much. Relaxing again, my mind drifts to her. The kind words, the dazzling smile, the way her eyes seemed to laugh. She seemed so nice, I think, smiling to myself. It's unfortunate we met under those circumstances. She must be so worried about her father, and her br— My eyes shoot open, and I sit up immediately. "...it...no, he..." I play through the memories again. This time, a memory less than an hour old burns its way to the front of my mind—and with it, ignition. A simple sign, reading: LV 5, CELL F: THUNDERSTRIDER, G. "..that's it. That's it!" I shout as I hop to my feet. How could I have missed it? In a frenzy, I rush out of my room, making a beeline for Buff's door. (edited)

Cass Allura 09-Nov-18 09:01 PM

Professor Buff Orpington 09-Nov-18 09:02 PM
“I said it was our deception.”
Cass Allura 09-Nov-18 09:02 PM
"Right. But you're wrong." I say, smiling.
"I mean, you're right, we had deceived him, sure. After our conversation at the bar, he could hardly be considered a 'fan' of ours. But," I say, pacing, "this is Velec. A man who deals exclusively in subterfuge, information, lies. Why would he be angry that I was being careful—so angry, that he attacked me in front of a crowded city street?"
Cass Allura 09-Nov-18 09:13 PM
"You see," I continue, quickly, "when you told me afterward that he had threatened us, I thought 'wow, I wish you had said something beforehand." I give you a withering look. "I still do, actually. That hurt. A lot." "But, that got me thinking! There are things that I have experienced that maybe concern you. Maybe there are things that have happened to me that I thought was disconnected from everything else. But, as I'm sure Velec would agree, all things are connected." I stop pacing, look you dead in the eye with a serious expression, and begin rattling off statements at a slightly faster than normal speed. "After I had spoken with Bulwark during one of my many visits to the Abbey, I was interrupted by a man. A man wailing for his son. He was inconsolable. His name was Leodegrance. He was beseeching Bulwark to help save his son. Leo thought that with Bulwark's connections in the Throne, he could help release his son from bondage: his dear son, Galahad Thunderstrider."
"Are you getting it yet?" I say, a wide smile on my face.
"Doesn't matter, we both know I'm going to continue explaining."
"Flash forward to our conversation with Velec. He had a man in the Throne he wished to return to Bluecliff, a man who had committed a crime. Velec wanted this man under his 'protection,' or perhaps under his thumb, who's to say." "When we arrived at the Throne, Velec and company quickly parted ways, but I kept an eye on them for a bit. You see, I may not be an academic like you, but I do have something you respect: curiosity. I watched Velec and his guards meet with an individual in the distance. It was hard to make out every feature, but," I say, looking at the bed, "he did seem quite familiar. I'm sure with your height advantage over the crowd at the time, you would agree." "NEXT. Velec gets his man from the Throne with the help of our friend Youen here. Bribery? Blackmail? Don't know, don't care. What matters is he transported Galahad back home, here, to a cell—a cell in a city he must know like the back of his hand." "Velec wants Galahad for something, but how to get to him? Well, Buff, what's the easiest way to get into jail?" (edited)
1
Professor Buff Orpington 09-Nov-18 09:34 PM
Throughout your explanation Buff’s faces changes from annoyance to something nearing entertained. “Ah Cass. Excellent. I understand your joy in calling me wrong but I did lack some critical information. Velec allowed himself to be arrested. Now continue.”
Cass Allura 09-Nov-18 09:42 PM
"Sorry, Professor, but how often do I get to do that?" I say, smirking in a friendly, not mean, way. "It explains why he was alone, why he was outside in plain view of the public, and why he openly fired at me. He immediately saw through my guard disguise, but he still fired on a "guard" in the eyes of the militia. All the better for him. I presented a means to an end for him, though the fact that it was me in particular probably brought him some cruel satisfaction," I say, rubbing my ribs instinctively. "Now, Velec is right where he wants to be, hustled away to jail. Now, this next part may be a stretch, but I want your academic opinion on it." "When we were in the cell today, we saw flames, yeah? Not regular flames. Blue flames. A magical blue like a certain elf's eyes during our trip to the Throne. Blue like...a Sapphire." (edited)
I stare wide-eyed at you, hoping for your confirmation or insight on this theory.
Professor Buff Orpington 09-Nov-18 09:56 PM
“The flames were clearly Velec, hence my rush to leave. Your information is insightful and fills in many gaps in my own working theory. There is still much to confirm, but this provides us a great deal more direction. You have more knowledge of these external individuals, so your insight on next steps will help guide my own.”
Cass Allura 09-Nov-18 10:02 PM
I am honestly a little shocked at the open praise from you. I smile, recomposing myself after my excited revelation. "Yes, well, I am happy to be of assistance. I am sure our insight will guide us down a path toward resolution." I furrow my brow in thought. "Despite all of that...there's so much we still don't know. Why did Velec want Galahad? What is so special about this particular Thunderstrider?"
I laugh. "Well, actually, right there is the question that holds the key to everything: what does Velec want? Though I have doubts that anyone alive knows the answer to that."

Professor Buff Orpington 09-Nov-18 10:32 PM
“We must move cautiously but not slowly. Velec can hear and see much more than any of us and his connections seem to be limitless. I would ask to keep most of this information between us. It is not for lack of trust but for lack of control. When Youen awakens I will need your knowledge to assist in my questioning. From there I will aid you as long as I know you have the will to do what is necessary to end this threat. He wields much power and thus his death is the only way to ensure I and those dear to me remain safe.”
Cass Allura 09-Nov-18 10:35 PM

“He would be an asset to us. You know, just foolhardy folks like us,” I say, smiling a little.
Professor Buff Orpington 09-Nov-18 10:46 PM
I don’t usually smile but I am very clearly not smiling in this moment. “What would you tell him? What would you ask of him? All he knew of Velec was that he is a skilled man he failed to recruit. His lack of either knowledge or diligence allowed Rook to be killed in Marshwreath. We have known this man for perhaps a month. If you must speak to him speak deliberately and with brevity. I would ask only questions of the Thunderstriders, and make no note of Velec’s threats. It is men like Locke, whose interests float between good and self interest, who become the greatest unknown factors.” (edited)
1
Cass Allura 09-Nov-18 11:20 PM
My smile immediately drops, and I close my eyes for a moment. I take a deep breath, exhale, then open them to give you a withering and firm expression. "Locke was the only one outside of a millennia-old Warden that offered up information about Starcross. Locke has been running a guild of adventurers before we arrived and probably long after we have left. He may not know every detail about Velec, but neither do we. What he may know? People who can fill in the blanks. And blanks seem to be in surplus for us, moving forward." There is a moment in my eyes, where something seems on the verge of breaking, its anger kept at bay by my words. "Also, and I will ask you this as someone who has 'more knowledge of these external individuals,' as someone whose 'insight on next steps will guide your own': do not talk down to me as you have done. Do not give me one-sided orders on what I must say. If you truly value my help, you will treat me with the respect of an equal. Whether or not you believe that, I do not care, but I expect to be treated as one regardless. You need me, just as I need you, by our own admissions." "We will discuss this more tomorrow. I will not speak to Locke until after a night of rest and after our discussion tomorrow. That is what a partnership entails: compromise. I will speak with you in the morning." I move toward the door, and as I leave, I stop, turning my head toward you. "Professor. Locke is not the reason for Rook's death. He warned us that, at the first sign of real trouble, we were to abort the mission. We, as adults, made our choice, and that choice cost a life. Do not make the same mistake I made and push your anger at the world onto someone else." I turn back toward the hallway. "Perhaps Locke floats between good and self-interest—perhaps he is too flexible. However...it is the inflexible tree that shatters in the storm. Goodnight, Professor." I walk out of the room toward my own.

Professor Buff Orpington 10-Nov-18 02:00 PM
“Unfortunately that was my plan as well. Very well. I should get to that then.” And I nod again, before heading back into my room.
Cass, the note is different from the letters you usually get from the Professor. It’s obvious the letter has gone under a bit of editing.
“Cass, Perhaps my words were poorly chosen earlier. I still struggle with this language, and on occasion, particularly in moments of heightened emotion, misstatements are common. My words were meant to be suggestive rather than directive. I speak so directly to you because I have found you to be very competent in your own increasingly wide areas of expertise. If my treatment of you caused hardship, I regret it and will attempt to be more deliberate in my speech in the future. I will apologize for saying Locke was responsible for Rook’s death but not the words themselves. Marshwreath was each of our first outing with the Guild and even I will admit I was perhaps too inexperienced to make a proper judgement call. Perhaps we all share guilt for Rook’s death. But I did my research. Thoroughly. As did we all. We entered Marshwreath understanding theoretically what we were about to encounter. We developed a strategy. If we had the option when facing the Beholder we would have left. We did our part. Locke should have made that call for that group of new adventurers when the villagers walked through that door and described to him a creature he knew to be the deadly beholder. He didn’t. I have lost lives under my leadership in the past, so I will not relieve him of the weight of his responsibility. I would advise you to share limited information and only what you must with Locke if you believe it is necessary. I would personally prefer we exhaust all existing options first, Youen, the girl, etc. I have been controlling in this situation because he named the address of my foster mother and specifically listed her as a target to be killed if we reveal the information of his activities to anyone. She exceeds me in every personal and academic regard and deserves to live. She is my priority in this matter. I trust this enlightens you as to my initial secrecy and my later behavior. Please refer to me if you plan on acting further. -Buff Orpington” (edited)
1
Cass Allura 10-Nov-18 10:46 PM
I read the note, staring at it for a few seconds after reading it. I close my eyes, take a deep breath, and exhale. I walk to my desk, place the note on top, and fall asleep in my bed.
