1
Cass Allura 12-Nov-18 10:31 AM
“I smell like shit,” I say to myself, as I walk into my room and close the door. Cleaning off the filth of the day and changing into different clothes, I sit at my desk, thinking and resting for a moment. Today went...very well. I mean, I smell like sewage, I fought a giant goo monster, and opened an EMPTY CRATE— I close my eyes and smile. Then laugh. I laugh longer and harder than I have in a long time. “I can’t believe it was empty. The look on my face must have been priceless,” I say, through tears. —..but in the end, we were victorious. Better than that, we didn’t lose anyone down there. I put my head into my hands, still laughing but also crying. “Thanks for not letting anyone die again,” I say softly. And you didn’t exactly get nothing. You have that letter you found, plus this amulet, I think, as I pull out the necklace. We’ll have to ask Bulwark about it next time we see him. Maybe he’ll know something about it. Staring at the necklace, I notice the paper underneath my door. I retrieve it, examining its contents. I blink, raising my eyebrows in surprise. “Well, well, Melchior,” I say quietly, smiling happily and sincerely, “I’m happy to have you on the team.”
1
Melchior Mori 12-Nov-18 12:02 PM
The Letter Reads "Today was interesting, I am glad that we all made it back relatively unscathed and I look forward to working with you again in the future. That being said I would appreciate if we kept what I did between us for now. I understand that you might have some questions, if so I am happy to discuss them with you. Thanks, Melchior Mori"
1
Cass Allura 12-Nov-18 02:30 PM
Finishing the rest of the letter, I furrow my brow for a moment, then relax. I pull out a page of paper and write a quick message. I head out of my room and slip it underneath Melchior’s door. As I head back to my room, I notice my typically empty mail box across the room is filled with something. Huh, I swear I checked that a few minutes ago. I walk to the mailbox, retrieving the parcel. Quickly reading the attached note, I go back into my room with an intrigued look.
Melchior Mori 12-Nov-18 03:21 PM
As I wake I notice another letter under my door. I walk over and unfold it
Jayko 12-Nov-18 04:48 PM
Over the next few hours, those of you that walk out of your rooms more often notice several odd occurrences. Sudden gusts fill the Halls of the guild and scatter papers, dense fog fills the main hall every now and again, Vines begin creeping out from under jayko's door and disappearing without a trace. Most noticeably you find Jayko talking animatedly with Rutga who seems to respond in kind and just as quick. At times it sounds like a language none of you have heard before.
1
Cass Allura 12-Nov-18 06:36 PM
The letter to Melchior reads: Melchior, Thank you for your letter. Working with you was great, and I, too, look forward to more adventures in the future. As for what happened, I will of course use complete discretion. We are a guild of secrets, I’ve discovered, and yours truly is no different. I do have some questions, so I appreciate your openness in answering them. Clearly, you are not obligated to answer all or any of them; as long as you’re not actively hurting innocent people, we should not have a problem. I am happy to hear that you want to do some good for this city; you and I share that in common. As long as that similarity exists, I expect we’ll get along swimmingly. See you around! Cass (the next great heroine of Irs)
1
Professor Buff Orpington 13-Nov-18 12:28 AM
The mission today went uncommonly well. We explored the sewers beneath Bluecliff and earned a considerable social and financial reward from the harbormaster. I have spent so much of my life in this city but much of it remains unexplored. Perhaps one of the others could guide me to the more common areas of Bluecliff. The culture of these southerners is corrupting my Noral sensibilities. Upon seeing what was in actuality an apparition, my instinct was to help, to my physical detriment. Additionally, my combat prowess proved to have deteriorated since Marshwreath. My robe has felt tight after all my complacent indulgences. The enemies ahead will require discipline and will. They must face Bafo Dragonseeker Orpotanu-Laga, not Buff Orpington. If this Bafo was forced to survive in the northern wastes he would be killed in minutes. I now have a considerable wealth, with more on the way once my debts and dealings are settled. But I am discontent with letting it sit idly in a bank like those lazy moneymongers. I will begin investing soon.
1
Loralith 13-Nov-18 02:52 PM
Loralith has gone some time without touching the pile of papers that were frantically shoved under her door by Jayko. At first she considered writing notes on each one and returning them to the lizard in frustration. But her irritation eventually turned to curiosity. Loralith swiftly gathers the papers into a neat stack and strolls out into the hall carrying them under her arm. She approaches Jayko's door, knocks calmly, and waits. (edited)
Jayko 13-Nov-18 05:39 PM

Jayko eventually gets the door open as the wind dies. "You get papers! Jayko has idea, Jayko wishes to collect more reagents. Jayko searches for different types, fire and Earth. Reagents are not in safe places, Jayko needs help with not dying. Loralith wants fight and Jayko thinks we get one. Or two. What does Loralith say?"

Loralith 14-Nov-18 09:23 AM
Loralith glances around Jayko's room. It looks like it's been hit by a hurricane. Her gaze falls upon Jayko. Not long ago, Loralith found Jayko's preposterous and enigmatic behavior to be little more than an annoyance. As she spent more time with him, she has grown fond of him and his unique perception of the world. He remains as cryptic as ever but his presence is more reassuring. Loralith has never had a pet save for a rat here or there to keep her company on a long ship voyage. But she imagines this is what it feels like to have a pet. Loralith smiles calmly at Jayko. "I would be happy to help you with not dying. I've been doing it a long time and I like to think I'm quite good at it. Where are we going and what sort of trouble are you expecting?" (edited)

Professor Buff Orpington 15-Nov-18 12:40 PM

a few hours later Jayko arrives back, once more noticing the lack of presence of the 3 fellow adventurers. Jayko walks up to Buff's door and knocks once, twice, three times. Professor Buff Orpington 27-Nov-18 06:30 PM
I slowly return to my room, trying both to take it all in and forget it happened. I close the door behind me, not bothering to lock it, and head straight to my desk. I reach for my notebook on myself and open it, skimming towards the middle, until the journal opens to a simple list. “Lord Iarneth, Trelawney,...” All in all about a dozen names. I take a long glance at my arm, before reaching for my pen and drawing a solid black X across the name Trelawney, matching the rest. I then begin sorting between the journals animatedly, looking for the one that holds all of the answers or at least could hold the right questions. Personal, no. Beholder, no. Archaeowyrm, no. In rapid succession, my eyes dart from journal to journal until, in a silent, desperate rage, I push them all onto the floor. I stand, breathing for a short eternity, before my eyes notice the blank sheet of paper on the floor. I scoop it up and leave my freshly untidy room, walking down the hall to Jayko’s room. I give his door one solid knock.

Professor Buff Orpington 27-Nov-18 09:17 PM

I have spent my live trying to prepare for the unknown. I have dug too deeply and too greedily into the surface of a world I do not understand, and consequence, blinding consequence has finally risen to meet me...” (edited)

Professor Buff Orpington 28-Nov-18 12:34 PM
I stand puzzled for a second, and answer suspiciously at first. “You do not-... I would-... I thank you for offering, truly, but I do not think you or even I can understand the power and danger facing us. I will accept your help on one condition: leave if the threat is of the scale I think. Flee. Understanding and blind camaraderie will serve you little in the oblivion. From one lost survivor to another. My own die has been cast, and when the time comes I do not wish another to suffer what my arrogance has brought upon myself.”

Cass Allura 28-Nov-18 06:45 PM
“Don’t say anything.” The girl’s words echo fervently in my mind, a mental plea to keep my mouth shut—for once. As the veil of darkness sweeps across the sky, and the sinister white light grows closer and closer, I instinctively put my hand to the amulet around my neck. I think about the powerful object, offering a way home—at an incredible risk. This is a last resort, Cass. You don’t know how well you can control this. I try to slow my breathing. But with the help of the Glidestep potion, maybe yo— A sudden memory of placing the potion on Jayko’s desk flashes horribly though my mind. I silently curse myself. ...ok, so you’re on your own, then. That’s fine. You’re fine. This is fine. My heart rate quickens as I glance at Loralith, who has just caught up to us, I assume having dispatched our fanged pursuers. No sign of Ubron. I’ll have some words for her in a moment; perhaps they will help in whatever is to come. As for Ubron...I hope he’s ok. I take deeper breaths as the light encroaches. It would be almost beautiful, if I couldn’t see the look of terror on Kara’s face. Inhale. I’m scared. That’s good. A little fear is good; it keeps you focused. We need focus. Exhale. I think of those at the guild, readying a message for Buff, Jayko, Locke—anyone, really. I pray I won’t need it, but I know better by now. I can’t help but smile at that thought. Hmph. The Professor would be proud of my healthy amount of nihilism. The light is almost here, taking on a humanoid shape. No more time for thoughts, Cass. As always, with the light, I think, gritting my teeth, comes action. (edited)
1
Cass Allura 29-Nov-18 02:52 PM
. . . . . . . . . . The doors to the guild push open, revealing three adventurers. Entering the guild and nearly running into Locke, he tells us that “someone dropped off packages for you.” Wow, they work fast. Heading to our respective rooms, Loralith, Ubron, and I stare at our wrapped gifts, shoot each other a tired look, and take them into our rooms. Closing my door, I set the package on the table, examining the blank piece of paper attached to the wrapping. Suddenly, a beautiful script appears along the paper: “For Adventurers who assisted a Lady discover her potential.” The script quickly disappears, the smile on my face staying in its absence. We did good today. We did a lot of good. I reflect on the events of our mission as I begin to unwrap the package. (edited)
1
I think of Kara’s worried face, replaced with a bright smile of possibility and newly discovered drive. I think of Nerivara’s icy exterior, cracking ever so slightly around her sister as they find some new common ground. I think of the changes to the Court, and what that means for their world—and ours. And....I think of Loralith and Ubron. In the midst of tense negotiations, they stood by my side, supporting my points, even if it wasn’t what they had initially agreed with. Loralith’s words stick out in my mind. ”I don’t want to make an enemy of you, Cass. I stand by you.” I doubt she thought twice about her statement, but it resonated in me. She trusted me. Despite her instincts, she trusted me. That’s...well, I don’t want to jinx it, but...I don’t have many friends, despite (or perhaps because of) my bluster. This...this feels like a step in that direction. Smiling at that thought, I carefully remove the last of the paper from the three foot long parcel. I see that it’s a long wooden box with a latch. Opening it, I’m surprised by what I find: several objects lie inside this box, next to a small container. Before I can reach for one, the assorted objects rearrange themselves and fly into the small container inside the wooden box. I pull it out and hold it aloft, smiling in spite of my surprise. The Lady in White sure does have an odd way of repaying her charges. My smile flickers for a moment, as the gift triggers a momentary flash of faint insight. I swear I’ve heard of this before, but... ..it’s no matter, I think, shaking my head of the escaped thought. I was never in it for the reward. I’m just happy that Kara is happy. Still, I think, stowing the container, an enchanted deck of tarot cards makes for quite the interesting gift. (edited)
1
Cass Allura 30-Nov-18 07:28 PM
. . . . . . . . . . Heading out of my room, I move to Jayko’s door and knock.
Jayko 30-Nov-18 08:33 PM
once more in the night, the door opens and Cass endures roughly 1 minute and 45 seconds of annoyed tired croaking paired with exhausted arm movements and ribbits as Rutga angrily berates Cass. The large red frog looks on at you in silence after the loud affair is over and then proceeds to point into the corner of the main room where you see the alabastor lizard crouched over the medicine table shrouded in darkness. Jayko is crouched over a pale liquid and stirring and pinching bits of solids into it. Just as the solids hit the surface bits of ember begin to coalesce over the liquid as Jayko slams a cork into the top. The embers start flowing in the opposite direction and downward into the liquid toward the bottom of the glass. Jayko rests backwards onto his haunches and takes a big breath then notices Rutga's angry stare. "Does the Cass require something? Jayko hears rutga making fuss over sleep" (edited)

Cass Allura 30-Nov-18 08:44 PM

“Ah, no problem, Jayko! I wasn’t sure how long that sort of thing took for you, and honestly, I can’t remember how long ago I’ve asked. It’s been a long day,” I say, laughing.
Jayko 30-Nov-18 09:24 PM

Cass Allura 03-Dec-18 03:39 PM

Professor Buff Orpington 03-Dec-18 03:40 PM

Simple archanobiological experiments an undergraduate student could conduct. Ideally, I would examine the animal’s interior while it is sedated, which I am more than qualified to do. These analyses will take place at the lab of an associate as I still lack anything resembling adequacy.”

Jayko 06-Dec-18 12:33 PM
Jayko comes grunting through the guild with wood beam after wood beam after wood beam. Rutga follows with smaller pieces as they make a ruckus throughout the hall and down into the basement. Professor Buff Orpington 06-Dec-18 12:39 PM
This morning I am indulging in an activity I don’t usually partake in - sleep. But the noise of clanging wood and a screaming lizard folk triggers whatever survival instinct remains despite years of southern coddling. I sit up at my desk, eyes fixed on the door. I creep towards the door, reaching for my greataxe, preparing myself for whatever awaits me. I slowly unlock and pull open the door... “Jayko. I was... Conducting research. What is it you require?”

nasterisks 09-Dec-18 05:30 PM
The Next Day | Day 11 ----------------------
 (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 13-Dec-18 08:19 AM
I return from the adventure, visibly frustrated. I head directly to my room, ignoring Blinky Steve, and begin venting my thoughts onto my fresh journal titled POLITICAL SURVEY. As I write, the thick paper can barely contain each vicious scratch of my pen. “I am not of the belief that charity is an objective moral good. If it must be done, it is indicative of failure, more frequently on the institutions of the world than the individual. I should not have had to help these people. This world is collapsing perhaps much faster than I had predicted. In the cities, the universities sit elitist and ignorant of progress, the church remains distant and self-important, the lords wealthy beyond imagination, only willing to spend it on wild self-indulgences, and the Throne, of course, in all its omnipotence grants only the image of impotence through systemic inaction. In the rural regions, the army is too focused on advancement of individual wealth and ambition to contribute to anything meaningful, and the people either starve or are killed trying to avoid their famine. In Noral, it was simple. Failed leadership met with a challenge. Oftentimes, even effective leadership had to overcome challenges. In times of strife or unique challenges, well-suited clanspeople would lead. My mother was suited to long journeys to resources, my grandfather, Laga, could navigate us through famine, even my brother, Kala, prepared us for war with a neighboring clan. If I lacked the knowledge this pretender was a god, I would challenge him myself. In the end, perhaps my actions were a cruelty. I have forced them into a brave, new world that will not welcome them kindly. Their 50 gold will perhaps be enough to secure housing in the slums, but when it comes to a job, they will find themselves unskilled for any task that will allow them any real security. I must refocus myself on the advancement of scientific progress and perhaps greater political and economic progress in Creissos.”
1
Jayko 13-Dec-18 10:57 AM
Jayko gets back and begins cleaning his scales, over and over and over of the dust from the cursed land. Jayko does not think it was wise to allow the cursed ones back to this untainted land. The consequences of this have yet to be seen, and Jayko will have to be there if they do. Just as Jayko begins to work on the soil again, Jayko peers at his bag. He drags its up to the main room and places it next to the alchemist table, and removes all of the specimens he had gathered, away from his still fragile soil. Jayko scrawls a rough note, "DO NOT EAT, CURSED SOIL" Then gets back to work (edited)
1
Cass Allura 13-Dec-18 12:39 PM
12 hours or so after the Professor and Jayko teleport back, the familiar glowing sigils appear in the lobby in midair, opening another portal to the Guild. There is a muffled gasp and words of astonishment heard from the other side, followed by a tentative hand reaching through the portal. It hesitates for a moment, then retreats. Moments later, Melchior and I walk through the portal into the Guild. There is a moment when I stare back the way I came, waving, and replying to muffled questions and concerns: “It’s not permanent—should be any second no—oh, there it goes! I love you, too! By—” and the portal is closed. Wiping at my face quickly, I turn toward Melchior. I thank him, with immense gratitude, for accompanying me on this detour. “You didn’t need to come along, but...it means so much that you did. You’re a great coworker,” I say, laughing. His response surprises and delights me, and fills me with joy as I make my way back to my room to unpack both my supplies and the events of the day. “That’s what friends are for, I suppose.”
1

Working on your nursery?” I eye the dirt and dusty tome.
Jayko 17-Dec-18 10:09 PM

Cass Allura 18-Dec-18 03:21 PM

’I’m very sorry for your loss?’ Come on, Cass.
I straighten up and cough. “Um, actually, that is a good transition into why I’m here. I made a recent discovery with that spell I was channeling today. Although it didn’t really help those folks,” I say, looking away for a moment at the thought, “um, according to my studies, I can isolate the area of increased plant growth to a certain degree, allowing for some focused fertilization. In other words,” I say with a sheepish smile, “I might be able to help you grow your plant nursery.”
Jayko 18-Dec-18 04:27 PM

Cass Allura 18-Dec-18 05:01 PM

Jayko 18-Dec-18 05:02 PM
Jayko guides Cass down to the now finished set up in the basement and shows her the two glowing white mushrooms he has 'de-spored' to begin cultivation
Cass Allura 18-Dec-18 07:14 PM
Ok, Cass, try not to fuck it up this time, yeah? You see me pull out a flute, however, it’s not the same one as before. Having replaced my wooden flute, this flute is thin and silver, with platinum inlay. The instrument is fully made of metal, yet is as light as wood. At the base of the instrument seems to be scrawling of some kind. I put the flute to my lips, and begin to play, channeling the spell.
Two things happen when I do. As I play, the room seems to thrum with energy. The air feels cleaner, the soil darkens for a moment, and the mushrooms begin to vibrate with a familiar faint purplish aura. The second thing that you hear is a soft harmony echoing from my flute, as though other flutes are playing along. The harmony is warm and supportive, swelling with the melody and providing a cushion for its descent. (edited)
1
Cass Allura 18-Dec-18 07:27 PM
Suddenly, a mushroom pops fully formed from the dirt. After a moment, another. Then two more. Then five more. Then ten. By the time I finish my song, two large clusters of forty or more mushrooms each have propagated in the soil. (edited)
I pull the flute away, smiling. I look to Jayko. “Is that...good? I don’t know how many mushrooms is a good amount.”
Jayko 18-Dec-18 07:39 PM
Jayko sits slack jawed staring at this marvel "Jayko... Is..." Jayko fiddles with a pair of pruning scissors "Yes" Jayko dives in and begins cutting this way and that and attempting to make the most of the bountiful quarry presented to him
Cass Allura 18-Dec-18 08:25 PM
I smile widely at your delight, then try to compose myself. “I’m so happy it worked! I’m glad I could repay some of the help you’ve shown me.” I go to put my flute away, then pause. “Um, I can actually do that one more time today, if you’d like? You’d just need to leave at least one mushroom. Maybe two, to be safe? Again, I’m not as familiar with this flora,” I say with a chuckle.
Jayko 19-Dec-18 12:40 AM

Cass Allura 19-Dec-18 09:55 AM
I grin from ear to ear at this. “That’s fantastic to hear, Jayko! Yeah, just let me know,” I say, putting my flute into its case and carefully stowing it in my bag. “Ah,” I say, covering my mouth quickly, trying to stifle a yawn, “I think that will do it for me today anyway. I’m going to get some rest, but I’m happy to have helped you. It’s nice to repay the favors,” I say with a tired grin. “I’ll see you tomorrow, Jayko! If there’s anything you need from me, you know where to find me.” With a little wave, I begin walking back to my room. (edited)

Cass Allura 19-Dec-18 08:29 PM
I look down at the flute in my hands, thinking of my mother and my father. I hold it tightly for a moment while closing my eyes in concentration. Today is the day. Today, we rescue a soul lost in a desert. Today, we throw ourselves at an undead king and his legion. Today, we push back against Fate in an attempt to undo the past. I open my eyes. And I’m ready.

Cass Allura 25-Apr-19 06:38 PM
The quiet reflection that fills the lobby of the Adventurer's Guild is suddenly broken by a dull FWUMP and the light smell of sulfur. Appearing mid-air near the ceiling of the room, Cass Allura lets out a quiet "oh" as she falls down hard onto the table occupied by the papers and coffee of @TapRepus, sending the contents spilling across the floor. Splayed out on the floor, unceremoniously attempting to extricate myself from the loose papers hindering my recovery, I look up at Ubron with a look of shock, then embarrassment, followed by a nervous smile. "..hey." (edited)

Ubron Zers 25-Apr-19 06:44 PM
"g'morning" Ubron extends his hand to pull Cass to her feet "That coffee was getting cold anyway"

Ubron Zers 25-Apr-19 07:08 PM

What you just witnessed was me trying to teleport to my room from downstairs. I thought I had a pretty good idea of what direction and distance was required, but..." I look toward the ceiling. "..I was a little off."

finally cracking a smile "at least eggs can't burn you"

Jayko 25-Apr-19 07:42 PM

1
Melchior Mori 25-Apr-19 07:43 PM
Melchior looks up from the book he has been studying and reaches up to rub his eyes in an effort to wipe away the fatigue. He slowly rises from his desk and stretches. As he does so a raven flies up from its perch on the desk and lands on his shoulder. He reaches up and scratches beneath its chin absentmindly. "I wonder what everyone else has been up to," he says to the bird as he makes his way to the door to his room, stopping briefly to examine himself in the mirror. Tan skin, black hair, but he could never bring himself to hide his orange eyes.
1
Cass Allura 25-Apr-19 07:44 PM
"GODS!" I jump and trip, falling onto the table again, but just managing to keep from falling over. I look at the Lizardfolk, my terror fading even as I grip my chest. "Jayko, you scared the hells out of me!" I laugh at my own reaction. (edited)
Jayko 25-Apr-19 07:46 PM

"When we got back from Aguhmoz, we all kind of split up to do our own things for awhile, and Rook was no exception. I feel kind of bad, I...I mean, we brought him back, but you two make a good point, I should have followed up with him, seen how he was doing. I got wrapped up in my own stuff and, by the time I considered him, he left on some trip somewhere."

Maybe we should wait until he engages with us." I turn back toward the two of you. "But what about you? I feel like I haven't seen you both much this past month, only in passing, really. Anything interesting happen?"
I smile. "Considering we lost Rook, traveled to the Throne, went on adventures, and brought a Warden's soul back to life in the span of a week and a half, I'd find it hard to believe things were completely quiet for a month. Though, I'd be lying if I said I didn't hope for that," I laugh.

Rook 26-Apr-19 06:49 AM

Professor Buff Orpington 26-Apr-19 08:46 AM
Hearing voices outside, the door of Professor Buff Orpington edges open. He shifts uncomfortably in his clothes, an elegant ensemble of fur, leather, and feathers acquired from Hilltec’s Haberdashery at the start of his tour. Buff effortlessly scoops up a stack of books and waddles into the common area. He gives each figure a glance and a nod, Rook receiving a notably longer look than the other adventurers. Before saying a word, he opens the cover of each book and makes a quick scribble inside, and hands a book to each person. “If you have already purchased a copy of my book, it is likely the first edition. Completely obsolete.” Buff slides a leather glove off of his hand and opens a copy of EYE OF THE BEHOLDER to somewhere near the back. An unintelligible sea of numbers and characters is displayed. “I was granted much more editorial discretion in the second edition. Aside from a few cosmetic and factual updates-” He nods toward Rook. “If Rook is no longer deceased, it makes no sense to take the time to honor his memory. More importantly, the appendix has now tripled in length. An ocean of raw data for your own analyses.” (edited)
1
Loralith 26-Apr-19 09:14 AM
Loralith sits in a corner of the common room of the Bluecliff Adventurer's Guild, quietly eyeing her compatriots. She has been observing them for quite some time, especially Rook and the newest member of the guild, Glurk. She has tried to keep her suspicions to herself and not betray her thoughts to anyone, but she has been considering Rook ever since they returned from the Throne. Anything that comes from the Throne deserves its due concern. Loralith did not know Rook well before he was lost to the battle of Marshwreath, but his behavior since they returned from the Throne has been interesting to say the least. Perhaps he was always like this, though. His recent trip to Aghumoz not withstanding, Loralith will need to be vigilant to avoid any surprises from this one. The little gremlin (or so he seemed) still had yet to show his true colors, but Loralith did not miss his glee at the shattering of Ubron's coffee mug. Despite his stature, caution is likely warranted. Loralith sits up as Buff walks out of his room to distribute signed copies of his book to the guild members. She must admit that while she suspected the contents of this book to be rather useless to her pursuits and incredibly dry (like most of her interactions with Buff on both counts), she had seen it plastered about the city like the most recent craze. Perhaps it would be worth reading simply to gain a better understanding of the professor. Loralith frowned as Buff gestured toward the appendix overflowing with facts and figures and bragged about its extended length. However, she still leaned forward and hoisted herself to her feet. She calmly approached the table that now had the majority of the guild gathered around it. "May I have one? I have been curious about this book that the city seems so interested in." (edited)
1
Professor Buff Orpington 26-Apr-19 09:49 AM
“Ah. Of course.” Buff signs the cover of the copy he had been showing off and hands it to Loralith, straining a bit as he tests the limits of his mobility in this new outfit. “I have just returned from a book tour of the major cities of Creissos. Interest is not simply limited to Bluecliff.”
Loralith 26-Apr-19 09:55 AM
Loralith takes the book from Buff and thumbs through the pages. She will have to dedicate some time to at least attempt to read this... thing. She doesn't even know what it is about, but she suspects it will be much like a conversation with Buff: verbose, one-sided, and by the end of it Loralith will wish it never happened. (edited)
1
Loralith weakly smiles and nods at Buff as thanks.
Rook 26-Apr-19 10:08 AM

“You went back to Aguhmoz? How? And why? Who is Master Xol? And Khorlo—and Lora—Behold—and...what?”

nasterisks 26-Apr-19 12:32 PM

Melchior Mori 26-Apr-19 03:24 PM
Melchior watched and listened to the group below from a perch in the rafters. Once there was a lull in conversation he untangled his senses from those of his Raven and pictured the other room in his mind. He mutters a few words under his breath and steps forward appearing no longer in his room but next to Rook and Loralith. The Raven flies down from the rafters and lands on his shoulder once more. PERHAPS EVEN A GENERAL. Professor Buff Orpington 26-Apr-19 10:04 PM
I spend this time observing Glurk’s behavior and making short, rapid notes on a piece of nearby scrap paper. With each word he shouts, I grimace slightly but charge forward in my effort. As he leaves, I breathe deeply. “It is true that we may all agree the overthrow of the old order is necessary for the prosperity of Creissos-“ I nod and look throughout the room as if for affirmation, though ignoring any signs of disagreement, before quickly continuing. “-I think we may also agree that this Glurk would be an unsuitable champion of our cause.” Noticing an apparent lull, I adjust my glasses and scan the room. “As much as I would enjoy dedicating the next few months to studying this creature, I fear another subject has piqued my interest, a subject that I understand you have experienced more practically than myself... the Summer Court.”
1
Cass Allura 26-Apr-19 10:47 PM

Professor Buff Orpington 26-Apr-19 11:06 PM
“Ah. Yes. I confess my knowledge on the subject is quite limited, but as I said, it has piqued my interest. You know of the Summer Court?”
Cass Allura 27-Apr-19 12:41 AM

Melchior Mori 27-Apr-19 04:29 AM
Melchior takes a seat near the group, he has been curious about the adventures he had missed. The Raven perched on his shoulder moves down to his lap and he runs a finger along the back of its head as he listens.
Professor Buff Orpington 27-Apr-19 07:25 AM
“The most pressing question is likely: what happened at the Orphanage and how does it relate to the Summer Court?”
Cass Allura 27-Apr-19 11:06 AM

After that, we...well, a lot of complicated stuff happened.” I pause. “If you don’t mind me asking, why do you want to know about the Summer Court?”
nasterisks 27-Apr-19 11:19 AM
Somewhat abruptly, Locke appears at the foot of the stairs. He's holding a letter and says "Cass, something else came for you. I figured since you were here I'd just give it to you." He looks at your mailboxes and sheepishly back to you. "I have to unlock it, then I have to make sure everyone has their mail... You get it." He waves it unceremoniously and places it on the table near Melchior.
Cass Allura 27-Apr-19 11:31 AM

nasterisks 27-Apr-19 11:48 AM

Cass Allura 27-Apr-19 02:07 PM
. . . . . A few minutes later, I walk down the stairs toward you all, my brow furrowed as I stare at my open letter. I quickly fold it and stow it in my pocket as I look back toward the Professor. “Sorry about that. Anyway, yes, why did you want to know about the Summer Court?”
Professor Buff Orpington 27-Apr-19 02:43 PM
As Cass answers, I nod and silently absorb the knowledge, taking long, penetrating looks at Cass, Loralith, and Ubron as she speaks. I open my mouth to respond just as Locke interrupts. After he finishes, I open my mouth again to speak, a flash of annoyance as I am once again interrupted. However, that quickly fades as I take a moment to let my thoughts simmer. As she returns, I say. “Perhaps a story for another time. Perhaps-... a story for closed doors and coded paper. But...-, Cass...” I lean forward and for the first time you see a look of almost giddy, childlike trust. Wrinkles bunch near my eyes and near my cheeks, smiling. “Opportunity. For the first time in a long while we have the opportunity to do more than just react. And I do not intend to squander this opportunity. For now, I ask no more than that you trust me to do what I judge to be necessary for Irs.” (edited)
1
Cass Allura 27-Apr-19 03:49 PM
I stare for a long moment, glancing at my companions nearby. "Ah. Yes. Um...well...you've certainly done much to earn my trust," I say with a nervous laugh. "Perhaps more details can be discussed, though? Trusting someone with the entirety of the world is a big ask, I'm sure you can agree. I can r—" I swallow my words suddenly, then continue "..I can certainly listen, though. You've more than earned that, Professor." I smile.
Rook 27-Apr-19 03:52 PM
Rook stares intently at Buff not saying a word
Finally turning away to @TapRepus “Anyway, if you are looking to improve your smithing I was planning on traveling to look for new techniques when we aren’t busy, I could always use company, and it would be a good time to practice. I have ideas that we just don’t have the technique for in these parts”
Melchior Mori 27-Apr-19 04:05 PM

Melchior Mori 27-Apr-19 04:24 PM

Ubron Zers 27-Apr-19 04:35 PM

Professor Buff Orpington 27-Apr-19 05:23 PM
I open my mouth to speak but close it as Rook and Melchior begin to talk. My face does not tighten in annoyance like before, however, instead melting, ever so slightly, in relief. I give Cass a serious look as I speak. “It is as I said-“ I move to follow the rest of the group. “-a story for another time.”
Cass Allura 27-Apr-19 05:31 PM
I hang back for a moment as the rest make their way to Melchior’s room. Then I say quietly to myself: “..come on, Cass, they’re being brave and sharing. You need to tell them.” I make my way toward Melchior’s room.
Melchior Mori 27-Apr-19 06:38 PM
As they enter the room Melchior snaps his fingers and the various lamps around the room spring to life. The Raven on his shoulder flies down to its perch on his desk. He turns to face the group and smiles "I'm going to be honest, I'm a little tired of having to do this in the guild, and there's a chance you've already seen my true form while I slept on our travels, but my kind can't be too safe" I shrug and roll up my sleeves, as I do I allow my disguised form to drop. My features remain unchanged for the most part, but the once tan skin fades to a fair pale color. The black hair turning an almost white blonde. Along my forearms are geometric patterns that look like feathers. "I hope you understand that it wasn't my intention to fool any of you, but there is a bit more that I would like you to see. I look to Cass and Buff I believe you two are familiar with this, as are Meta and Jayko so it is ok that they are not here." Melchior tenses for a moment and erupts in radiance. A halo of braided light and shadow appears above his head as two wings made of light sprout from his body. The whites of his eyes darken as his orange eyes start to glow leaving them looking like two bright embers. The geometric feathers on his arms remain lit up as the orange energy flows around him lifting him off the ground. (edited)
1
Cass Allura 27-Apr-19 07:00 PM
I stare slack jawed, the display immediately dismissing my previous thoughts. “..I don’t think I’ll ever get used to that, Melchior. It’s...incredible.”
Melchior Mori 27-Apr-19 07:06 PM
I look to Cass and smile. There is a slight reverb to my voice as I speak "Thank you, I can't stay in this form for too long, but it greatly augments my abilities in a fight. Unfortunately I have a feeling that we'll be needing it more in the future and I didn't want to catch anyone off guard."
Cass Allura 27-Apr-19 07:11 PM
I hesitate for a moment, before “..I have a feeling you’re right.”
Rook 27-Apr-19 07:13 PM
“I can see how this would be useful, but I also see how it could make you a target, I recommend to use this sparingly
*his pace still slow, but as his emotions do not show through speech the speed he talks is the only indication this threw him off. *
Professor Buff Orpington 27-Apr-19 07:21 PM
I squint and adjust my glasses as Melchior reveals his form. I silently pull a notebook from my vest and scribble inside, all the while my fixed on Melchior. “Yes. Useful indeed. I have been distracted of late and underutilized how... unique some members of the guild are. It would be quite fascinating to study you and the energy emanating from you at some point.”
Melchior Mori 27-Apr-19 07:29 PM
I look to Rook "Yes, there are plenty of cultists, demons, and devils that would love to say they murdered an Aasimar. I try to hold this back until it's needed but sometimes instinct takes over I offer a small laugh before looking to Buff
It would depend on the tests, but I could be ok with that. As to the energy I can tell you that it is radiant, celestial in origin." (edited)
Ubron Zers 27-Apr-19 07:31 PM
Ubron has a look of awe on his face. He closes his eyes a few times, and rubs them "This...umm....is....uhhh... Impressive? I don't have anything this impressive to contribute to the cause"
Cass Allura 27-Apr-19 07:42 PM
My eyes go from awe to shock at Ubron’s words. I look at the belt on your waist. “Ubron...didn’t you mention that belt makes you pretty strong? I believe your words were:” at this point, I use Mimicry to perfectly replicate Ubron’s voice, “‘I could benchpress the Professor’?” I give a little wink at the end. “I may be paraphrasing.”
Melchior Mori 27-Apr-19 07:52 PM
After about a minute the radiant energy fades and I look to Ubron "We all bring something to the table. There is one last thing I'd like to show you all, so there are no surprises in the future that might throw any of you off. I look to the Raven on my desk and it flies over and perches back on my shoulder This is Mortecai, he was a gift. I close my eyes and I where I once stood only the bird remains, flapping its wings to hover. A moment passes and I return with Mortecai back on my shoulder. I smile again. This could be useful for scouting I think."
"Those are all the surprises that I have to share for now. Feel free to share your own if you wish Laugh"
Cass Allura 27-Apr-19 08:48 PM
I look for a moment at the rest of the people in the room, then laugh. "Well, I'm sure we all have a surprise of some kind. If not now, then I'm sure soon, at the rate today has been going." I look toward Melchior. "Thank you for trusting us. You didn't have to do that; I won't take that for granted. I imagine the room feels the same."
My hand absentmindedly goes to the letter in my pocket. Then a thought. "Oh, Melchior, actually, could we have a quick chat in private?" I look to the others with an apologetic smile. "Sorry, I don't mean to be rude, it won't take long. It doesn't have to be in your room, either."
Melchior Mori 27-Apr-19 09:00 PM
"Yes of course."
Cass Allura 27-Apr-19 09:10 PM
I nod politely to everyone in the room, then lead Melchior back to mine. As I'm closing the door, you hear, "So, remember when I opened that empty crate for my reward at the docks..." The door closes.

Glurk 30-Apr-19 10:21 AM
The doors to the city swing open. In walks a shady and elderly looking man in a long coat, looking angry and upset. As he walks across the room the elderly man starts...shrinking? His gray hair starts turning black and receding to a single strip at the top of his head, his skin goes from a pale white to a bright orange all while continuing to shrink down- -revealing Glurk. "CURSE YOU WATERSIDE WEST! YOU HAVEN'T SEEN THE LAST OF PROFESSOR BLÜDBOOK! YOU'LL SEE. YOU'LL ALL SEE." This isn't to anyone in particular. This is more for Glurk. He needs the confidence boost. Glurk suddenly has an idea and he scampers quickly to his room and shuts the door. (edited)

Loralith 30-Apr-19 02:07 PM
Loralith has been out for most of the day. Late in the day, she walks back into the guild carrying a small stack of packages in front of her. They bounce lightly as she calmly walks down the stairs. She walks into her room and places them gently on her bed. She walks over to her desk, grabs three sheets of paper, a quill pen, and some ink. She writes for a few moments on each before moving onto the next. Once she is finished writing, she waits a few minutes for the ink to dry before folding each paper. She then grabs three of the four boxes and places them next to the paper on the desk. She glances at each paper before affixing them securely to each box with a pin. Loralith takes the three boxes and places one in front of three of her guildmates' doors. One for Buff, one for Ubron, and one for Melchior. She then returns to her room and shuts the door. (edited)

Professor Buff Orpington 30-Apr-19 03:03 PM
As I finally catch up to Ubron, I say, “Tell me, Ubron, what is it that you wished to know?”
Ubron Zers 30-Apr-19 03:03 PM
"Please come in" gesture for Buff to enter my room
Professor Buff Orpington 30-Apr-19 03:05 PM
I follow Ubron inside, and look around at his room.
Ubron Zers 30-Apr-19 03:08 PM
"Don't mind Jin" nodding to a man sitting at a table "I've been spending some time working with the militia in the last few weeks, they assigned him to me for assistance. You can trust him." "But as I just said, I've been working with the militia in the last few weeks, and while they are aware of the actions of the guild here, they generally don't really interfere with what we're doing. Is there some reason you know of that they in particular want you to assist with something that's going on over in the circle?"
Professor Buff Orpington 30-Apr-19 03:17 PM
I give Jin a suspicious look, but defer to Ubron’s judgement. I begin pacing and my face grows strained as I speak. “Ah. Yes. Of course. Tell me, Ubron, do you know why I, despite my title, currently spend my time completing tasks for lesser men rather than conducting research and teaching at the Academy?”
Ubron Zers 30-Apr-19 03:18 PM
"I don't. I'll admit I am curious, but it has always been your choice to share that information."
Professor Buff Orpington 30-Apr-19 03:31 PM
“It is because I am disruptive. Despite what some may say, there are far colder and more unlikeable men than myself occupying the highest echelons of Bluecliff academia. My research and beliefs have proven to be far too radical and disruptive to make me acceptable in any circle other than this one. A social target has followed me at every turn, and now that I have risen too high, too fast, Bluecliff will once again seek to drive me back into the dirt.” I stop pacing. “I discovered through a xenophobic heckler that I have been circumstantially tied to the disappearance of two noblemen. Because of my beliefs, my race, and... the evidence, I am likely the primary suspect.” (edited)
1
Ubron Zers 30-Apr-19 03:32 PM
"I'm not being accusatory here...but are you involved?"
"I won't be turning you in, but it is important that you are truthful."
Professor Buff Orpington 30-Apr-19 03:44 PM
“I am... unlikely involved-... However... an associate and I did hold him for a short time and interrogated him regarding Velec, an at large rival. After we discovered he was mostly useless and amnesiac, I returned him to Waterside West. For my own security, I departed immediately.”
Ubron Zers 30-Apr-19 03:52 PM
Ubron glances to Jin. Jin furrows his brow looking concerned. Ubron calmly nods to him "How much of this story are you willing to share with the authorities?" "I find that honesty goes a long way. This isn't strictly legal, as you likely know, but it seems like if this really is the entirety of the story, there was no real harm done. This could provide some useful details to the investigation." "As I said, I won't be turning you in, and I won't go back on my word; but there is only so much my influence with the militia can mean if you won't be offering your assistance to them."

Professor Buff Orpington 30-Apr-19 04:28 PM
I take a second and think. I nod as I begin to speak. “Your words are useful. I will first determine what they know and what I, and Loralith, are being accused of, if anything. Without any incentive, I do not see of any reason to divulge any of this. It will do nothing but incriminate me in the kidnapping of a member of Bluecliff nobility, which, for someone already reviled and targeted by the elite, will likely result in more than a slap on the wrist.”
Ubron Zers 30-Apr-19 04:31 PM

I don't know if you're interested in the fancier things or if you're more of a utilitarian. I hope either way you'll find a use for this. Loralith (edited)

Cass Allura 01-May-19 04:35 PM
I sit, staring at the incredible gift in my hands, as the sight of it triggers a flood of memories. I smile as I think of my mother and father, their joy at my love of performing and their masked concern at the discovery of my magic. I think of my plays, my songs, my dances, silly little things that meant so much to me back then. My eyes drift up to the tapestry of Cassandra on my wall. Resplendent in gleaming platemail, her sword hefted across her shoulder with a look of brave determination on her face. I stare at this figure, this champion, this heroine of Irs that inspired me, molded me. The one who sent me down this path. She... Something in me shatters. I don’t know why it was now of all times. Was it seeing everyone again? Was it because things have been going well? Or is it just because I was happy? Whatever the reason, I know in my heart the breaking was inevitable. A lump forms in my throat as I think back to the words I received, the danger from my antagonist turning to grief when instead they come from me. “Through you I found a path.”
The tears begin to roll down my cheeks, unnoticed as my distracted mind keeps remembering. I think of Marshwreath, staring death in its eye, watching it snuff out life so easily, with such disinterest, before turning its sight toward me. I think of the note I wrote, still locked in my desk drawer, written as a frantic departing warning to the guild, the city, the world. I think of Melchior. Of Loralith. The Professor, Jayko, Ubron, Meta, Locke, Bulwark, Weadrid—so many faces, so many lives, all at risk. Because of you, Cass. My instinct to hide my feelings, my pain, my weakness, is overtaken as sobs rack my body, my tears staining my cloak. Exhausted, broken, and alone: all of it my own fault. I stay like that for a minute, maybe two, maybe more. I don’t keep track. Then I open my eyes and look down at the mandolin. Beautiful, capable of inspiring greatness in the least of us. Delicate, vulnerable to so much damage, easily destroyed. It’s heartbreaking. And yet I find myself smiling. Something about this instrument, my instruments, this moment and all that came before, have showed me a truth. Something that’s hard to express, but something nonetheless. So I do what I’ve always done when I need to express something. I pick up the mandolin, playing a few notes and refrains. Then I begin to sing the truth. No gimmicks, no lies, no flair. For the first time in my life, I finally feel...honest. (edited)
5

Loralith 02-May-19 10:20 AM
When the team returns from the Bluecliff Militia HQ, Buff and Ubron go into Ubron's room to get some documents copied. Loralith waits in the common room for them to finish their business so she can speak with Buff in private.
Ubron Zers 02-May-19 10:26 AM
Once the documents are finished being copied, anybody in the common space sees Jin out of the guild with a stack of papers
Professor Buff Orpington 02-May-19 11:44 AM
Emerging from Ubron’s room, I delicately handle the originals, placing them on my desk in my room, before heading to the common room to confer with Loralith.
Loralith 02-May-19 01:41 PM
Loralith looks up at Buff as he reenters the common room. She gestures toward her room and begins walking in.
Professor Buff Orpington 02-May-19 02:33 PM
I follow, and take in the room as I enter.
Loralith 02-May-19 02:37 PM
Loralith's room is relatively sparse. There are a few weapons and a backpack leaning against the corner near her bed. Her desk is clear except for a single box that resembles the one your cloak was delivered in. The book you gave her is sitting in the center of her bed.
She gestures for you to have a seat at her desk chair as she walks over to and sits on the bed, angled toward you.
Professor Buff Orpington 02-May-19 02:52 PM
My face is severe after our experiences in Rodrick’s Circle, but soften as I see the book on your bed. I take a seat and speak. “Tell me, how are you enjoying my work? It was my most difficult text to write yet, in part because of the deliberate steps I took to make it approachable and... conventionally entertaining.”
Loralith 02-May-19 02:56 PM
Loralith glances at the book and then back to you. "To be honest, I haven't gotten very far into it yet. I've had a lot on my mind. Thus far it has been interesting, though. I'm not one for large appendices containing raw data. I expect I'll forego that section. I prefer a more... hands-on approach. I'm sure you had your fare share of that during your research for this... tome. What drove you to write and publish this piece?"
Professor Buff Orpington 02-May-19 03:11 PM
“Yes. The appendices are likely intended for the few, like myself, that prefer numbers to narrative. The reason for the writing of this book was simple. I am both an adept warrior and an adept academic, though I would rather identify with the latter. Before Marshwreath I studied everything available in Bluecliff on Beholders, I spoke to colleagues who thought themselves as the experts, and I crafted the best possible plan for facing a beholder with a team of similarly competent individuals. Despite what I will forever know to be my best efforts, it took less than a second for a beholder to destroy everything of Rook but a soul. I saw two approaches: I could run, weep, and never confront the danger again. Or I could confront it, learn from it, harness the power that incinerated my ally and use it to prepare this world and myself for greater threats. This book is the results of the second course.”
1
Loralith 02-May-19 03:20 PM
Loralith nods as you speak. "I appreciate the importance of persisting despite a setback, especially one so dire as the death of a companion. It is actually your persistence that has driven me to have this conversation with you." Loralith sits up very straight. "I hope you'll forgive me, but I'm not very good at small talk." Her eyes become very serious and she looks deeply into yours, ready to gauge your reaction. "I know where Velec Tesivo is."
1
Professor Buff Orpington 02-May-19 04:03 PM
My face once again freezes and strains. My look lingers for a few, icy seconds. “Tell me.”
Loralith 02-May-19 04:05 PM
Loralith takes a deep breath. "Before I go any further, I must warn you that this information is not given lightly and if you were to share it with anyone, I would not be able to guarantee their safety... or yours. Do you accept this?"
Professor Buff Orpington 02-May-19 04:08 PM
Before you even have the chance to finish, I say. “Yes.”
Loralith 02-May-19 04:12 PM
Loralith leans forward and speaks quieter. "Velec is in the dungeons of Astelloth. He has made an enemy of my people as well."
Professor Buff Orpington 02-May-19 04:19 PM
I sigh deeply and let your words settle. “And what will your queen do with him? As I think on this, there are two outcomes I would deem to be acceptable: One, I inform the militia of the location of Velec, sparking a diplomatic crisis, yet leaving myself free from Arcadia’s blackmail. Or two, your queen executes Velec and allows us to bring the corpse to the militia.”
Loralith 02-May-19 04:21 PM
Loralith looks puzzled. "What could this Arcadia woman really do to you that would be worth starting a diplomatic crisis?"
Professor Buff Orpington 02-May-19 04:26 PM
I dismiss this quickly, with a wave of my hand. “As I said, one of two solutions.”
Loralith 02-May-19 04:30 PM
Loralith sighs. "Well I can't guarantee that the Queen will execute Velec anytime soon. I expect she is going to try to get as much information out of him as possible before then." Loralith frowns. "And if you tell the militia, that would be bad for all of us. I guarantee you don't want that." Loralith thinks for a moment. "Perhaps I could talk to some people and see if you could be allowed to go to Astelloth and make your case?"
"Or, alternatively, I could help you free yourself from Arcadia's blackmail without involving Astelloth."
Professor Buff Orpington 02-May-19 04:39 PM
“Yes. I would advocate both solutions. I have hoped to visit Astelloth and as an educated foreigner actively opposed to the Throne, I believe I could effectively make my case. But Arcadia is a corrupt incompetent. Bluecliff would benefit from her demise.”
Loralith 02-May-19 04:42 PM
Loralith smiles. "Let me get in touch with my contacts and I'll see what I can do. I expect you're right. Your opposition to the Throne can only help." "And as for Arcadia... If she's looking for Velec, it's only a matter of time before she discovers the truth of his whereabouts. It would be best for both of us if she was out of the way."
Professor Buff Orpington 02-May-19 04:53 PM
My face lightens and a small smile appears in the corners of my mouth. “Yes, Loralith. Very good. While an expert in many subjects, intrigue has proven beyond skill set. I will defer to you and your associates. I would ask you to keep me updated on both matters, and inform me if you need any assistance. You have proven yourself to be most useful, Loralith. I look forward to our continued partnership and a partnership with the people of Astelloth.” I stand to my feet and give you a nod. “In retrospect, an alliance between Drow and Goliath seems quite natural after all.”
Loralith 02-May-19 04:56 PM
"Indeed." Loralith stands as well and reaches out to shake your hand.
Professor Buff Orpington 02-May-19 05:00 PM
“Ah.” I look down at your hand. “Yes.” I reach out and give your hand a quick shake.
Loralith 02-May-19 05:01 PM
"I'm glad we had this talk. I'll get to work right away." Loralith walks toward the door and opens it for you.
Professor Buff Orpington 02-May-19 05:36 PM
I give Loralith a nod and march back towards my room. (edited)
Melchior Mori 03-May-19 02:28 AM
After returning to the guild Melchior asks Ubron to let him know when he has completed his copies of Buff's papers so he can get started on his own. He thinks back over his time at the guild and realizes that he had no idea there were such dangerous people in Bluecliff, and if they pose a threat to his guild mates and the citizens of the city then he would need to learn as much as possible. Even if it slowed down his own current research. He wanders the halls of the guild looking for @noobmignon to get his thoughts on what he had heard at the Militia.
1
Jayko 03-May-19 08:31 AM
you hear a tinking of metal on glass, a pause and a sniff, then a rock crystal glass being filled Jayko appears to be talking to Rutga in another language animatedly while tapping the side of the glass and touching the now smoking remnants of a leaf. He ends his soapbox with a cork with a hastily drawn skull on the top sealing the tincture. Jaykos language slowly shifts to common ".... Rot is necessary but outright destruction... This kills cycle."
1
Melchior Mori 03-May-19 03:46 PM
Melchior smiles as he enters the room "Hello Jayko, are you trying to kill a cycle or preserve it?"
Jayko 03-May-19 06:30 PM

Cass Allura 19-May-19 01:49 PM
The doors to the Guild burst open, the lightning from the storm outside illuminating an intense and exhausted bard. I am dressed in different clothes than before, in an elegant crop top that shifts through shades of blue in the light, with long pants that billow with the breeze of my travel, the geometric shapes on its fabric creating new patterns with every step. However, my nice clothes are at odds with the rest of my ensemble. My hair, usually huge and free, is pulled into a tight bun behind my head. In my arms I carry two or three full costumes of clothes, made of various bright color schemes and much cheaper fabric. Along my body, I have slung my various instruments: a drum carried on my back, the mandolin slung across my chest, and the flute in its holster by my side. Under my left arm are stacks of bound pages, with circled text and scribbled notes peeking out from the mess. Finally, on half of my face is makeup. Different than makeup I’ve worn before, you see my features have been accentuated through hard contours, thick eyeliner, and bright lipstick. The other half of my face seems to be wiped clean, though I seem to have missed a few spots. I look around at the rest of the room. “..hey.” (edited)
1
Meta Tron 19-May-19 02:13 PM
Meta looks up at Cass from the couch, grinning at the unusual appearance of the bard.
1
“Hey... new look?”
Cass Allura 19-May-19 02:28 PM
I laugh. “Not quite, though,” I say, looking down, “I may have to bust these clothes out more often. I’m a fan.” I sit on the arm of the couch, careful to not crush the drum on my back. “I had the longest day. I finished my mission with the missing girl last night, right? Well, this morning, I get a missive from the Barded Larder, where I usually perform. Apparently, the usual performer cancelled, and they needed someone to fill his spot, because there were some visiting nobles in town who wanted a ‘slice of life’ tavern experience.” I roll my eyes a bit at that with a grin. “So, I had to go on. Except nobody told me it was an all day event.” I sigh, a couple papers falling out of the bundle to land at your feet. “I had to learn lines, blocking, dances, and songs in, like, an hour.” (edited)
1
Meta Tron 19-May-19 02:46 PM
“Hmm, seems like you could use a nap. That always helps me after I do anything resembling hard work”
Cass Allura 19-May-19 02:49 PM
I grin and chuckle. “Meta, you read my mind.” I look around the room. “Did I miss anything while I was gone?” (edited)
Meta Tron 19-May-19 02:53 PM
“Probably, but that’s what naps are for. Time for us to catchup on stuff” (edited)
Cass Allura 19-May-19 05:31 PM
I smile at that. “Sounds like a plan. For now, though,” I say, hefting my things up, “I’m gonna drop this off in my room. Be back in a second.” I walk to my room and open the door. I set down my things, glance at my reflection, and quickly wipe away the rest of the makeup before heading back out.

Professor Buff Orpington 20-May-19 12:33 PM
I burst from my room, the door slamming against the wall, as I charge forward towards the bounty board. I am clad, once again, in only my robe with a dense stack of loose papers, journals, and materials pressed between my arms. I glower at all the occupied space on the board, turning away and continuing my charge towards a wide expanse of the wall to the side of the fireplace. Animatedly I fix the sea of papers to the wall, connecting some with an enigmatic assortment of strings. Like a machine, blindingly fast and systematic, I cycle between the materials, occasionally taking a second to scribble or tear a paper down, working away as you speak.
1
Some of the papers hanging on the wall seem to be official documents of some sort, others are simply hastily done sketches of figures both familiar and unfamiliar, but most are written on an unusually thick paper, densely packed with small runic letters.
Jayko 20-May-19 12:40 PM
jayko skitters in close to get a look at some of the papers

I take in your words. “It’s interesting. You all have someone who helps you, but each in different ways. That’s...that’s really special.”

Cass Allura 20-May-19 12:48 PM
I smile. It’s a little sad. “Still, I can’t help but be envious. It sounds nice regardless, having someone on your side with that much power.”
Jayko 20-May-19 12:49 PM
"why is Cass cry? Jayko thinks power is good but draws attention. Jayko would rather owe nothing"
Cass Allura 20-May-19 12:53 PM
My eyes go wide as my hand goes to my face. It’s wet. I had cried a tear without realizing it. “I...it’s...it’s no—“ My voice catches. “Oh gods not now, hold it toge—“ The thought is crushed by involuntary sob.

Cass Allura 20-May-19 01:16 PM
I look into the concerned faces of my guildmates. I think long and hard, trying for a moment to think of a lie, an excuse, anything, I can't tell them, I can't, what will they do wh— A flash of red eyes. "Through you we have found a path."
1
I stop. I drop the façade. I look up at Jayko. "Jayko...I like to think you're right. That maybe Cass only needs her own power. And I tried." I look to the entire group. "I really tried. I tried to shoulder it all. I tried to do it alone, but I couldn't and I can't. I...."
A deep breath, then a sentence.
"I need help."

Cass Allura 20-May-19 01:40 PM
I walk into my room. It’s not as messy as it has been in the past, with only a few papers scattered across my desk this time. There are various things in my room, but the object that stands out the most is a large painting of a warrior.
I look at the painting for a moment, then turn to address everyone. "Does anyone know who this is?"
nasterisks 20-May-19 01:44 PM
Locke nods up and down, casually looking to the others. "Cassandra. Hero from couple thousand years ago." Realizing no one else said anything, Locke crosses his arms and goes back to listening.
Cass Allura 20-May-19 01:47 PM
I smile. "That's right. Cassandra was the heroine of Irs. The first one. The one who saved our world." I take a breath. "A couple thousand years ago, an ancient being of immeasurable power appeared on our plane. Her appearance alone shook the foundation of Mount Sarkos, changing the landscape around the mountain forever. Her name was Mathandror, the Red Dragon."
Loralith 20-May-19 01:49 PM
Loralith briefly glances at Buff at the mention of a dragon.
1
Professor Buff Orpington 20-May-19 01:50 PM
I perk up at the mention of dragons and move closer.
1
Melchior Mori 20-May-19 01:57 PM
Melchior continues watching Cass intently
Cass Allura 20-May-19 01:58 PM
My eye glances toward the Professor as well. "There's a reason I knew about your archaeowrym, Professor." "Mathandror had this world by the throat. She wasn't powerful. She was power itself. Immutable, unstoppable power, the likes of which this world had never seen, on a scale none could hope to oppose." "..until a common woman came along. A woman named Cassandra, who, guided by a Sage, went on a quest for an artifact strong enough to slay the entity. And she found it, the Sword of Glass, deep within the Eclipse Labyrinth. And she found friends, in the form of the Elven Ranger Tevioc and the Warden Blackstar. Together, they fought their way up the crags of Mt. Sarkos, to confront the beast."
I smile a little at this next part. "..and she won. Cassandra stabbed Mathandror with the Sword of Glass, mortally wounding her. Mathandror, sensing her own death, used the last of her power to teleport away—taking Cassandra with her." "..and that's it. That's the story. Tevioc was tragically slain fighting back an army, and Blackstar fell into a deep crevice in the mountain, lost for millennia. Cassandra is immortalized as a hero, with Priests of Iun singing her praises and passing down her story for the ages. Until one day, it reached me. I...I was so smitten with her painting," I say, gesturing toward the picture, "that my parents named me after her." (edited)
"And the rest is simple. I fell in love with the story of Cassandra. I wanted to be just like her. Strong, brave, kind, and just. I wanted to be the next great heroine of Irs."
Rook 20-May-19 02:05 PM
“I sense a ‘but’ coming here”
Cass Allura 20-May-19 02:06 PM
My smile fades. "When I got to Bluecliff, I went to the Abbey. If anyone would have more information about Cassandra, it would be them. I met Bulwark, and he allowed me three questions, questions he answered in visions."
"The visions were incredible. I saw Cassandra, walking up Mt. Sarkos with Tevioc and Blackstar. I saw the three of them at a campfire, discussing the meaning of life. I saw a deep cave of darkness, with a lighted eye opening, like a Warden's, like Blackstar. And—" (edited)
My voice wavers. I close my eyes, then open them. Without realizing it, I've been gripping my mom's flute, having removed it from its holster subconsciously.
nasterisks 20-May-19 02:09 PM
Locke uncrosses his arms, furrowing his brow. He leans in the doorway, craning to hear Cass' next words.
Cass Allura 20-May-19 02:12 PM
"..and I was shown a fourth vision. This time, Bulwark wasn't there, as he had always been. It was just me, in this sea of grey expanse. There were glittering pieces of glass suspended midair. In the distance, I saw a hill of something. I had walked towards it, until it began to move. And rise. Up. Up, up, and up. Towering above me was Mathandror. The Red Scourge. The embodiment of Power. Breathing. Glaring. Growling at me. She leaned back—to kill me, I was sure—but instead moved to allow a figure passage." (edited)
1
My eyes begin to tear up.
"It...it was her. It was Cassandra. My hero, but...her eyes. Her eyes were red. Red, like Mathandror. Red, like Power. Red, like...destruction."
"She looked at me and began to speak. To snarl. Spitting words at me, so confusing that I could barely comprehend them. She spoke of being used, used by the Mercurial Dragon, to fight Mathandror. 'The Sword and the Shield, at odds for eternity. But no more.'"
Jayko 20-May-19 02:15 PM
jayko shifts uncomfortably, a nervous tick only Cass would have seen when the beholder had the upper hand in their first outting.
1
Rook 20-May-19 02:16 PM
Rook seems more attentive at the mention of the mercurial dragon
1
Cass Allura 20-May-19 02:18 PM
I give Jayko a tearful look. "She then showed me something. Suddenly, the vision shifted. I was on Mt. Sarkos, but it was different. It was covered in ash and fire. And...and I looked out from my vantage point at the top of the world and I saw....the same. Everywhere was ash. Where Littlemeadow would be. Where the Throne would be. Ridgespire, Shadefield—Bluecliff. All fire and ash. Nothing was left." I'm openly weeping. My voice wavers as I try to push on.
"I looked at Cassandra in horror. I asked why. She took a step toward me and I instinctively drew my sword in fear. Against my hero. Against Cassandra. And then she answered with a phrase. Just one, but enough to break me."
"'Through you, we have found a path.'"
1
I look at all of you. "Bulwark appeared and pulled me out of the vision before anything else could happen. He tried to console me, but I knew what I saw. He told me it was a vision but I knew what I felt. It was real."
"..he later told me I saw the Astral Plane. The Astral Plane works differently than our reality. Once an entity enters the Astral Plane, it cannot escape, nor can it die. When everyone thought Cassandra died, she had actually just shifted to the Astral Plane. And stayed there, for millennia. Waiting. And waiting. Until I showed up." I look horrified. "She shouldn't be able to leave. To cause the destruction that would end our world. She should be trapped for eternity, the heroine that saved our world. And yet...her words echo in my waking hours and shout in my nightmares." "..she found a path through me. I'm the key to her destruction."
I go to my desk and unlock the bottom drawer, pulling out a crumpled piece of paper. "When we first fought the Beholders in Marshwreath, Rook was lost and I almost followed close behind. One more hit would have killed me. So, I wrote out a message, one that you would find on my body and hopefully—somehow—find a way to complete."
I hold up the letter toward you all.
1
Jayko 20-May-19 02:31 PM

"...but I can't stand by and let people die. Not like Rook. Not my family. Not you all. Not the Guild or Bluecliff or Creissos or Irs."

Cass Allura 20-May-19 02:37 PM
I look up at you, my face twisted in pain. "But I'm not strong enough. I wasn't strong enough to save you. I couldn't fix Shadefield. I couldn't stop the cultists. I can't do anything. I'm useless!" I shout that last part. "How the hells am I suppose to save the world when I can't save my friends?!" Electricity arcs from my fingertips, connecting to my desk, burning a small hole in the corner.
1
I slump against my desk, my head in my hands.

Cass Allura 20-May-19 03:01 PM
I stare in shock at the group's words. I don't move for a moment. Then I leap to Melchior. I wrap my arms around his back, bury my face in his shoulder, and cry. I cry loudly and for a good while. No disguises. Just Cass. (edited)
Melchior Mori 20-May-19 03:04 PM
Melchior freezes for a second, almost caught off guard, but returns Cass's hug.
1
Loralith 20-May-19 03:05 PM
Loralith shifts awkwardly. She is clearly not used to such overt displays of emotion.
1
Cass Allura 20-May-19 03:06 PM
I pull away, looking at Melchior, half-embarrassed, but fully grateful. Looking toward the rest of you, I suddenly remember something.
"I...I'm not always the best at showing my thanks, or connecting with people. Bluecliff is a far change from Littlemeadow. But...but I made something. A song, one that flashed through my mind in a moment of inspiration in the second before we leapt down to save Rook's soul. The last half was aspirational, more of a hope than a fact, but...you all have proven it right." I close my eyes and raise my hands without thinking. "I can't thank you enough for your support...but maybe this will help show how I feel now."
I begin to sing, and something strange happens. It sounds like music is accompanying my voice, but with instruments not present in the room or easily recognizable. You all hear a song: a song full of pain, worry, rage, and hope. Cass' Song: "Dear You." (edited)

Professor Buff Orpington 20-May-19 04:08 PM

The question asked by Queen Vhondrael flashed through my mind: ‘What will you do when the world burns?’ The cruel blue eyes of Velec and his taunts at my questioning. Even the words of Arkadia. There are far more players than simply two in this chess match. “This warden beholder, Starcross, my dragons, Cassandra, and your connection to all this demand further study. These are all great threats but they are indeed opportunities as well. With that understanding, Cass, as always, I will help you.” (edited)

Cass Allura 21-May-19 07:15 PM
I give a nod, making my way to @RockinRockhill’s door. I knock twice. “Professor? Do you have a moment?”
Professor Buff Orpington 21-May-19 07:39 PM
The door swings open to reveal a presently unoccupied room. A stack of garish clothes unceremoniously sits crumpled in front of you. Beyond that, a sea of neatly stacked journals rest, each with a deliberately carved runic title, mixed in with copies of a random assortment of books, ranging from thick tomes documenting alchemical case studies to thin and aged reports on some odd rural disturbances, though about half of the books appear to be copies of ‘Eye of the Beholder’. The desk in the center of the room is covered with papers filled with tiny text and rough sketches. Most notably, a drawing of a crude mask sits at the top of the pile with an unusually manic font. The smell of blood and chemicals you recall from your first visit to the Professor’s room has faded, but hints still linger in the air. From behind you, you hear a voice. “Ah. Of course. Unfortunately my room has proven to be too small for my present research, though I would concede it was likely too small for any past research as well. I have been forced to use the lobby to fully absorb this sea of information. It has been a trial, contending with the dog, conversations, and Meta’s napping noises, but, as always, I persevere.”
1
Cass Allura 21-May-19 07:42 PM
I jump a little at the voice, turning quickly to face you, my hand on my chest. “Gods, you scared me!”
I shake off the surprise, then glance back into the room. “I can certainly see what you mean. You put papers like these,” I say, gesturing to the table, “on the bounty board, too, yes?”
Professor Buff Orpington 21-May-19 07:54 PM
“I did place my notes related to Starcross on the board. These notes, however-“ I indicated towards my desk. “Are entirely unrelated. Threads, miscellaneous research, thoughts-“ I look towards a weapon blueprint sitting near the top of the pile. “...Personal matters... but if we are discussing Starcross, let us do so with my research in front of us.”
Rook 21-May-19 07:55 PM
Rook approaches as well “This is less about Starcross, and more about other events and happenings you have been involved in”
Cass Allura 21-May-19 07:57 PM
I raise my letter up, gesturing towards Rook’s, as well. “Seems the Militia wants a word with us, too.” (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 21-May-19 08:09 PM
I sigh and rub the bridge of my nose. I seem more annoyed than anything else. “Ah. Yes. Of course.” I look to Rook. “You, Rook, will be fine. Simply continue to remain uninformed on anything that has transpired between your death and resurrection.” I look to Cass. “You, on the other hand, know a bit too much. You will have to lie.” I lean forward to whisper. As subtle as our open trips to the Throne with known criminals, fights in the streets, de facto kidnapping of a lord, and resurrection of a warden have been, it seems our work has been noticed in Bluecliff. But I tell you, not for sake of self preservation but in truth, they know less than they say. They will try to trick you or blackmail you, but your refusal to aid an organization of corrupt incompetents will have the same impact as cooperating with them. Do not assist them. And, if you would take my advice, I would suggest you to do less than not assist them.” (edited)
1
Cass Allura 21-May-19 08:13 PM
I give a worried glance to Rook, then back to Buff. “..ok, a lot to unpack there. First of all, what happened?” (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 21-May-19 08:31 PM
“Upon our arrival to the militia, I understood what would occur. The questions were related to our history with Velec, Lord Youen, and, yes, Starcross. It began with a series of simple questions, then what might be considered the real interrogation - all of which I answered honestly with full intent to cooperate with the militia to bring justice to Starcross and Velec - and then, the true intentions of the militia revealed. Loralith and I sat alone with Arkadia in a room where we were blackmailed by her to assist their investigation into Starcross, specifically by capturing a alleged member of the organization, based on what was revealed to be nothing but racism and heresay.” I pause after this. Though all of this seemed to be nothing more than a dispassionate retelling, something seems to be bubbling up. My words come out slowly with biting and almost melancholy deliberation. “I do not expect you to understand, but Bluecliff is my home. After all these years, I thought that Bluecliff is my home. But I understand that even with no evidence, it would take Arkadia little effort to bring the courts and the people against those like Loralith and I. But you have a choice in this matter.”
Rook 22-May-19 09:59 AM
Rook turns to Cass, and though he doesn’t portray vocal emotion it seems like he jokes “At least there are some advantages to having been dead”
He turns back to @RockinRockhill “And in the meantime, you are now researching more of Starcross for the city?” (edited)

Professor Buff Orpington 22-May-19 11:51 AM
I give you a quick nod. “Perhaps Professor Buff Orpington is a part of the city, but the city remains unconvinced. Though I thank you, I assure you, I need no convincing that I have more than earned my place. It is simply that I grow weary of earning and re-earning my place.” I seem to shed this conversation and adopt, once again, my stoic, monotone demeanor, turning to Rook. “I am presently conducting my research independently. Though I have utilized some city militia resources, their heavy handed touch seems to have driven Starcross in Bluecliff perhaps more into waiting than hiding. I do possess leads, however, that need to be pursued. Though the one instance of combat I witnessed of you, you were handily defeated, I trust you, like the rest of us, have grown in capabilities since, and would invite you to aid me. ”

I say this next part quietly, as I’m thinking out loud more than anything. “But now I have to decide who to bring as my guest—if I bring anyone at all.”

Professor Buff Orpington 22-May-19 02:45 PM

Professor Buff Orpington 22-May-19 03:43 PM
I pause for a second, then continue seemingly unshaken. “Very good then. That is quite excellent to hear. But I think, perhaps for both of our sakes, it would be easier to simply arrange an audience between myself and your Master Xo, yes?”
Rook 22-May-19 03:44 PM

Professor Buff Orpington 22-May-19 04:23 PM
“Of course. Fine. It will have to be by proxy then. Ideally I would benefit from some blueprints of the Masters’ design to study, but I assume those cannot be delivered transplanarly. Then I would seek to understand the Firmament. Not to build the weapon, but to understand the weapon itself and the source of its power. Such a discovery could reshape our economy, end warfare, advance medicine, among other things.”
