Cass Allura 24-May-19 11:18 AM
. . . . . I’m back in my room, doing some writing as I think about the errand I signed up for with Meta and Jayko. ’Honestly, Cass, this will be good for you. You can let loose a little.’ I smile. ‘You’re not shouldering the world alone anymore.’ I close my book, leave my room, and head over to @MementoMori’s door. I knock. “Hey, Mel, you got a second?” (edited)
Melchior Mori 24-May-19 12:04 PM
you hear a rustle the rustle of parchment, and a scratching of quills from the other side of the door before receiving a response "Yes of course, be right there." the door opens a few seconds later and Melchior stands before you smiling, though perhaps not as brightly as usual "Please come in."
Cass Allura 24-May-19 12:06 PM
I walk inside and glance around. “Hey! Been busy?”
Melchior Mori 24-May-19 12:30 PM
As you glance around you see a few things. The room is lit by various oil lamps and candles, and is overall pretty sparse. The room has a simple bed and mirror, and a sizable desk. Upon the desk there is scattered parchment. You see drawings of two ships, one is beautiful. Constructed of a dark almost black wood, and golden fixtures, with matching black sails trimmed in gold. The other is decrepit and the drawing is smudged in places and the lines are scratchy. There are holes in the hull and the sails. There are also pages with the following words Last taken by: Haldraen Grimforge Decedents of: - Master Uddilynn Ironbrand (b. 2440) - Master Natroda Rumnaheim (b. 2397) - Master Thummougrett of the Blackforge (b. 1923) Lastly there are a few old books on the desk, with one titled “The Queen of Shadow” on top. On a hook on the wall is a coat that you have not seen Melchior wear, like the ship in the drawing it is also black with golden trim along the collar, buttons, and inner lining. Melchior offers you a seat before responding "I suppose you could say that he laughs mostly doing some errands for some families in town, and researching a few things at the academy. How are you feeling?" (edited)
1
Cass Allura 24-May-19 12:38 PM
“A lot better. I can’t express how good it feels to get that Cassandra stuff off my chest.” I seem a little tired, as the crying had drained me a bit, but there’s a pleasant smile on my face. “Lucky to know all of you.” I walk over toward the coat, admiring it. “This is beautiful. Did Hiltec make this? I thought our orders wouldn’t be done for another several days..?” (edited)
Melchior Mori 24-May-19 12:49 PM

Melchior walks over to the coat and and runs a hand down the sleeve, with a sad look on his face "No.. No this is old, though I have not worn it in a long time. It's a memory.. A reminder of another life." (edited)
Cass Allura 24-May-19 01:15 PM
“It certainly was. It threatened to break me, if I’m being—” I stop when I see the sad look on your face, listening carefully to your words. “..would you like to tell me about it?”
I shift somewhat nervously. “I’ve...told you all a lot. And you’re right, the burden was unbearable. So if I can alleviate some of that burden for you, I’m happy to listen.” I give a comforting smile. (edited)
Melchior Mori 24-May-19 01:45 PM
I turn to look at you, studying your face, wondering how this new information might change your perception of me. I give a small shrug and move to take a seat at the desk, Mortecai flies from my shoulder to his perch on the end of the desk. I gesture to a seat across from mine. "Are you familiar with the Nox Aeterna? I'm not sure how well known it is in Bluecliff, outside of the docks anyway. But where I come from, it was infamous. he pauses for a moment and watches your face as he says the following We were infamous." (edited)
1
Cass Allura 24-May-19 02:12 PM

Melchior Mori 24-May-19 02:38 PM
I nod "It was a ship, a pirate ship. I pick up the drawing of the black and gold ship and hand it to you It was named in an old tongue, loosely translated to "Eternal Night". Notorious for demanding respect from all who came into its path, and for the punishments it dealt if respect was not given. How I ended up on the ship is a story in itself, but it was my home for ten years, and it's gone now." (edited)
Cass Allura 24-May-19 02:39 PM
I trace my fingers across the parchment. “...what happened to it?”
Melchior Mori 24-May-19 03:51 PM
I look down "I failed." I'm quiet for a moment, trying to get my thoughts in order. "I have visions, dreams of things to come, instruction from above. I dreamt of the Nox Aeterna docking at my village before it arrived, I dream of things that I should do. People who need my help, places I should go. I have a guide, one that offers advice. I've known her since I was five. I pick up the drawing of the other ship I started dreaming of this ship, black as shadow and nearly as immaterial. Crewed by shadows and the dead. I thought they were just dreams, nightmares. A ship like this could not possibly exist, right? My guide, Myllandra, offered no guidance so I ignored the dreams. I didn't warn them. But I was wrong, and I paid the price. tears well in his eyes as he recites the names Drake, Jacoba, Lorrin, Feletherial, Maggus, and the others. They all lost their lives because I was stupid. Yet I live." (edited)
1
Cass Allura 24-May-19 04:07 PM
I stare in shocked silence. I go to speak, then lower my head, my mind racing for something to say.
Cass Allura 24-May-19 04:14 PM
Finally, I lift my head, look at you, and pat the bed next to me, motioning you to sit.
Melchior Mori 24-May-19 04:27 PM
I move from my seat to the bed as I continue to speak "We tried to fight them back, Drake, our captain had a strong knowledge of magic. He attacked the ship with enough fire and lightning to burn half of Bluecliff to the ground but it wasn't enough. I still remember the clouds above the ship, clouds so dark that no light could break through. It moved through the water as if it were air. Before I knew it I was floating in the sea surrounded by the wreckage. I felt I was dying. I may have, I cannot say for certain." (edited)
Cass Allura 24-May-19 04:50 PM
I let the silence hang for several moments, processing this information while waiting until you’ve said all you need and want to say.
Then I turn and look you in the eyes. I see the tears welling up. I see the unearned guilt. I see the quiet hurt, the silent regret, the pain, the pain, the incredible pain hidden behind a smile and a helpful word. You see tears welling up in my eyes as I turn to look forward for a moment. My jaw is set as I let out a deep breath. And I take your hand into my own. You can feel the scarring on my left hand, the mark of a vengeful beholder that almost took my life. I squeeze your hand and just sit there.
1
Melchior Mori 24-May-19 05:13 PM
I return the squeeze of your hand as I continue, my eyes are unfocused but faintly glowing as I remember "I remember floating in darkness, surrounded by whispers. A language I had not heard in all my travels, one that I don't believe could be understood, yet it made sense. A phrase echoed through my mind "Fate claims all, Lightrender." I remember the sound of wings and rustling feathers. And I awoke on the shore, unharmed, my clothing I gesture to the coat on the wall unsinged. It felt like my mind had expanded and I found I had knowledge of magic. My free hand rolls up the sleeve of my held hand These geometric feathers are the symbol of the deal I struck that day."
1
"I have been hunting the ship for the past two years." (edited)
Cass Allura 24-May-19 05:52 PM

Melchior Mori 24-May-19 06:07 PM

I know it might sound confusing, why should anyone want to save a bunch of pirates, it's complicated. But I found out some new information recently. I wasn't the only survivor, and I think that's the key. The fault wasn't mine alone."
Cass Allura 24-May-19 06:10 PM

Melchior Mori 24-May-19 06:35 PM

Cass Allura 24-May-19 06:44 PM

Cass Allura 24-May-19 07:11 PM

Cass Allura 24-May-19 07:25 PM

Cass Allura 24-May-19 07:46 PM

Cass Allura 25-May-19 01:52 PM
“It’s a structure far north of here, I believe. Like the name implies, it’s a labyrinth, a maze, meant to test only the worthy. At the center of it is the ultimate prize, a weapon, capable of slaying even one of the ancient dragons. The Sword of Glass.” I lean against the desk. “A couple thousand years ago, Cassandra started having visions of the Sword and was led to the Labyrinth by a Sage. She completed the trails within and emerged victorious with the Sword in hand. The rest is literally history.” I grimace for a second. “..I’ve been seeing visions of the Sword of Glass.” (edited)
Melchior Mori 25-May-19 02:26 PM

Cass Allura 25-May-19 02:42 PM
“I’m not sure, honestly. I...I really hope I can have help. I’m not sure if I want to do this alone.” “As for the Sage...” I laugh a little nervously. “He...he may have already found me.” I sigh. “I guess I should give more details. I’ll try to make this quick.” “At the Abbey, there’s this pool of water. At least, I think it’s water. It’s supposed to show you something, something unique to each person who views it. But for me...it transported me. It’s only several inches deep, but...I somehow managed to fall through it. At least, my consciousness did? It’s confusing. That’s when I found myself in an ocean of some kind, but I could breath. That’s when I saw Rook. I know now that...I was in the Astral Sea.” “When I was down there, I saw a sword. It was always just out of reach, but when I finally grabbed it, it...rejected me. At least, at first.” I pull at a strand of hair and begin twisting it. “This past month, I spent every day trying to swim farther down, trying desperately to grab the sword. Until one day, the ocean shifted and I landed on solid stonework. I looked around and saw a maze of tunnels and passageways. I saw my arm glow green and when I lifted it, more of the location materialized: including, finally, the Sword of Glass.” “That’s when a figure behind me spoke. I turned to see a cloaked bearded form of...someone. He spoke of the Sword. He told me it was in the Eclipse Labyrinth, but I needed the three keys to access it.” I use Mimicry to emulate his voice. It’s raspy and short. ‘Three Keys. Three Kingdoms.’ “He ended it with this. Something...unsettling...to say the least.” A short pause as I look right at you. “‘Obtain the Sword. Only then, can we unmake her. The hero I created.’”

Rook 28-May-19 01:17 PM

Melchior Mori 07-Jun-19 07:57 PM

Jayko 07-Jun-19 08:20 PM
jayko tilts his head at melchior “Why sorry? Little one completed her circle. Jayko just remembers lessons she teaches, makes jayko more... like you ones” jaykos eyes grow strangely focused on you after that last sentence (edited)
Cass Allura 07-Jun-19 09:07 PM
’..like you ones.’ My face falls at Jayko’s words, a sudden sadness making my chest grow tight. My grimace shifts to resolve, as I turn on my heel and head quietly and quickly back into my room. (edited)
Cass Allura 07-Jun-19 11:46 PM
After several minutes, I emerge from my room with a bundle of something in my hands. I cross down the hallway, staying out of sight as I make my way to Jayko’s door. I crouch down and extend my arms, revealing a stack of papers. One by one, I slide a dozen or so papers under Jayko’s door. After that, I pull out a different sheet, this one stained a light blue. There is some writing on it, but its contents are unknown as I slide this final sheet under the door frame, a corner of the paper still peeking out into the hallway. Seeing this, I hesitate for a moment. ’What if he hates it? Or he’s offended? What if this is dumb?’ The thoughts linger for a moment, before being brushed away by a sudden vivid memory. I smile at the thought, kick the paper the rest of the way under the door, and head back to my room.
Jayko 08-Jun-19 12:10 AM
jayko says his thanks for the flute, giving it a few practice blows on the way back to his room. Though rusty, it's still there. He comes to the frame of his door expecting Rutga there but finds the doors closed, he opens it to find papers over the ground. "Rutga make mess...."
jayko begins picking up the papers
Cass Allura 09-Jun-19 10:11 AM
As you pick up the papers, you eventually see the blue sheet. There are words on it, a letter, written in Common. The letter reads:
Jayko, After our run-in with the Cult during our latest mission, and then again in Waterside East, it’s clear this problem is escalating. With that knowledge, I want to offer my services in your quest mission task from the Queen of Rot; I fear a deadline is hanging over our heads, and I’d rather not wait until it runs down. Please make contact with me when you have more information, or a plan for moving forward. I’ll keep my eye out for any information floating in my circles as well. Also, Jayko, I wanted to thank you. In the short time I’ve known you, you’ve proven yourself a very reliable ally, in and out of combat. Your support has been invaluable, and I hope to continue repaying that kindness. I hope this can be one such way. But...I also was considering something helpful and personal in the meantime. I’d been thinking about this for awhile, after noticing your reactions to certain behaviors among our guildmates. So, I thought I would ask if...if I could help teach you gestures and phrases? I don’t mean to come off condescending at all, but you seemed to have shown interest in the past. I don’t know if I’m the best teacher, but I will certainly try! If that’s something you’re even interested in. Which is fine if you’re not. Honestly it sounds dumb now that I say it and All this to say: maybe you’re not as outwardly emotional as me—few are, honestly. But you should know that we care about you, and I couldn’t think of a better way to show that than by bridging the gaps in communication between you and your friends guildmates friends. If you’re interested, I left you a dozen or so ways to contact me under your door. Signed, Cass (edited)

I grab my book, a pen, and check myself in the mirror, quickly making several exaggerated expressions. Then I swing wide open my door to face you. “When would you like to start?”

Rook 10-Jun-19 10:43 PM

1
Professor Buff Orpington 10-Jun-19 10:53 PM
Blinking away exhaustion, I open a journal and rapidly scan it, hoping to find some missing piece of information, to no avail. More information will be necessary if we are ever to understand Starcross. I am not some corrupt Bluecliff militiaman, filling in the gaps with hearsay and gossip until a conclusion appears - the facts will lead me to my conclusion, but I will require a great deal more. Frustrated, I toss the journal aside and look around my room for some way to be productive until I begin following up on my Starcross leads. Settling near a relatively short stack of books, texts, and journals, I begin searching through it. At the top rests Professor Monromi’s newest archaeological work. I give it a respectful scan, before moving on. Below it sits a copy of Professor Tinkerton’s newest anthropological survey. I read the affectionate note on the cover, and gently set it to my side. Finally, my eyes rest on one of several nearly identical journals. The one I hold now is lighter than the rest. The first dozen pages contain tight, ranting scribbles, while the next contain some grand ambition for a sociopolitical survey of the people of the Thronelands. I furrow my brows at this, mechanically making a few edits and corrections as my mind wanders deep in thought. After a few seconds, I rise to my feet, journal tucked at my side, and barge through my door straight towards Cass’ room. I give the door a single, solid knock.
1
Cass Allura 11-Jun-19 02:53 PM
The door swings open. “Oh, hi Professor! I thought I recognized that knock.” I smile. “What’s up?”
Professor Buff Orpington 11-Jun-19 03:12 PM
I give a nod in your direction. “Yes. At the moment my research in all directions has, unfortunately, taken a pause. I have no doubt it will continue as I begin to follow up on these new Starcross leads. As I am anything but an indolent man, I will utilize this time to reflect.” I give you a look that exudes weariness and knowing. “Much has been accomplished these last months. We have gained much in wealth, influence, renown, and have been fortunate to lose little. But circumstances have not earned their due reflection... even from myself.” Though my face remains hard, the journal fidgets ever so slightly in my hand. “Regardless. With that said, I trust you still keep in contact with the people of Shadefield and the people of Marshwreath, yes?” (edited)
Cass Allura 11-Jun-19 03:18 PM
I blink in surprise. “Oh! I...well...” My face begins to grow hot at the realization. “..I actually haven’t been in contact with them.”
“I guess I assumed that...Locke..or someone..” My voice trails off as the guilt begins to hit.
1
Professor Buff Orpington 11-Jun-19 03:24 PM
“Ah.” My body grows heavy and my eyebrows furrow at this. I hold your gaze for awhile, more exhaustion than anger. “Yes.” A few more moments pass. “Tell me, Cass, do you remember seeing a new color for the first time?”
Cass Allura 11-Jun-19 03:26 PM
“I...I can’t say I do, Professor.” I give you a wary look, your anger never easily concealed.
Professor Buff Orpington 11-Jun-19 03:49 PM
I give this a few slow nods and begin pacing as I speak. The words come out even more slowly and deliberately than usual, each syllable soft and almost to myself. “You must forgive me as I am no poet. Perhaps your own alma mater surpasses my own in that field... It is not that Norl truly lacks green, but the green in the north is muddy, almost brown, it is the lichen and the needles you eat when there are still a dozen miles left in the hunt. Ugly and bitter. When I first lay eyes upon the Thronelands... the mind has difficulties grasping the new. Your backwards elite have proven that over and over. At first, your green grass fields were nothing but tall lichen to my young mind. But all at once it overwhelmed me, like the sight of Tyrioc on the mountain. I thought that with so much green, your people and your deer would be so fat from the plenty, that I smiled from the border with the Elvenlands to Bluecliff.” I even allow myself a rare, tight smile in this moment. “In truth, I allowed myself many years to hold onto this fantasy. Perhaps up until a few months ago. I spent my life in Bluecliff walking between my home in Waterside West and the Academy. But now, the green once again overwhelms my mind.”
Cass Allura 11-Jun-19 03:59 PM
My face softens a bit, my stare peppered with concern and a pinch of confusion. I walk back into my room and lean against my desk, giving you a long look. I gesture you inside the room, if you feel inclined, and I listen.
Professor Buff Orpington 11-Jun-19 04:23 PM
I nod and enter. “There are many in Bluecliff I would allow to starve. But regrettably, they are not the ones that will do so. But as for the rest... I owe nothing to them. Everything that they are owed is from their impotent king and corrupt lords, as uncaring or powerless as they are to provide it. But... in our Goliath clans, there are two loyalties that drive every action. The prime loyalty is to the clan. To work for its survival, preserve its posterity, and ensure its superiority among the tribes of Norl. The second is to the self. To advance among the clan, pursue your own ambitions, and secure your own needs. My mother, Professor Tinkerton, in the first book I coauthored at the age of 12, noted that the two ambitions do not work against one another. A stronger clan is better for the individual, just as an ambitious individual is for the clan. It is clear that we have done very little for this clan of Bluecliff, or at least that more could be done. A weak, hungry, and corrupt city that has lashed against us is a reflection of that.”
1
Cass Allura 11-Jun-19 04:50 PM
I take a long minute to think in silence. I glance at the letter from the Militia sitting on my desk, an approaching discomfort full of uncertainty. I think about Kara and the Orphanage, those children struggling to find reasons to smile in the poverty of Waterside East. And I think of the people from forgotten villages, the grime and blood of tragedies on their face mixing with the already present pain and confusion. I narrow my eyes, then look up at you. “..you’re right, Professor. There are people falling to the wayside, either out of the Militia’s reach—or out of the Militia’s mind.” “..how can we make a change and help this city?”
1
Professor Buff Orpington 11-Jun-19 05:53 PM
I give you a solid nod. “Yes.” I open my notebook and begin making notes as I speak. “I, since Shadefield, have had an ambition for a sociopolitical survey of the Greater Thronelands. I would, for sake of time, allow us to scale the project down to the level of Bluecliff, or even a single borough, with the implications of such a change noted. The questions may seem a bit odd, but I assure you we need every one of them completed.” I indicate towards a column of questions written in Common. “Professor Tinkerton believes that meaning can be drawn through conversation, deviating from a strict set of questions, while Professor Humboldt places faith only in numbers, measuring the health of a population by wealth in coinage.” I lock eyes with you eagerly. “I will be pursuing a new, third path. We will seek to accumulate a set of descriptive data: a combination of quantitative data with room for the subjective narrative. A measure of poverty cannot, after all, be determined by income of gold, as a fisherman can consume his own wares earning no income while a carpenter cannot. We will not be limited by conversation either, as every individual would likely consider themselves too poor. You should begin by interviewing the refugees from Shadefield and Marshwreath.”
Cass Allura 11-Jun-19 05:56 PM
My eyes dart a bit as I digest this information. “Yes...yeah, that seems like a good way to do things. So if we collect this data, we’ll have a better idea of where and how to help specifically, right?”
Professor Buff Orpington 11-Jun-19 06:02 PM
I look at you seriously. “Gathering this information is the only way we will have any idea of how to respond.”
Cass Allura 11-Jun-19 06:06 PM
“I see.” I lean back, crossing my arms and craning my head back. “Will you be accompanying me with the interviews, or is this a solo mission?”
Professor Buff Orpington 11-Jun-19 06:11 PM
“I have designed a new method of measuring poverty and will be independently analyzing whatever information we obtain, so this study will not be a solo mission. But so as not to corrupt the interview results with my... intimidating presence, I will not accompany you. Your assistance will be noted in whatever might be published as a result of this, I assure you.”
Cass Allura 11-Jun-19 06:15 PM
I smile at that last sentence and give a quiet chuckle. “Well, I appreciate that. It would be quite the honor to share the page with Professor Buff Orpington.” I reach for the notebook. “May I look over the questions briefly?”
Professor Buff Orpington 11-Jun-19 06:30 PM
“Of course. I will-...” I grimace. “Cede this journal to you for the duration of the study. Familiarize yourself with these questions.”
Cass Allura 11-Jun-19 06:33 PM
I give you a bemused look as I take it. “Alright, thank you. I’ll...be very careful with it. No need to worry.” As I say that, I surreptitiously nudge one of my own ratty notebooks on the floor behind me under my desk and out of sight.
As I glance through the questions, I take out my old, purple notebook from my bag and set it open on my desk. I begin taking notes on my notebook with my right hand while I hold your journal and read with my left. Occasionally I’ll raise an eyebrow at a question, glance up, and seeing no change in your demeanor, continue writing.
Professor Buff Orpington 11-Jun-19 08:32 PM
I stand throughout this process, holding a steady eye on your journal. After a few minutes, I begin to fidget, checking my pockets for a hidden journal to no avail. Disappointed, I wait for you to finish writing or ask a question about my work.
Cass Allura 11-Jun-19 09:20 PM
“..there.” I look back at you. “..are you sure you’re fine with me taking the journal? I could just copy the questions themselves, if that’s more convenient.”
Professor Buff Orpington 11-Jun-19 09:26 PM
“Yes. Quite fine. I chose the wording very carefully and I do not want any meaning to be lost through human error. And for my own future comfort I would like the survey results to be input directly into my journal. Please refer to me if you have any questions. This will be among my most important projects, and I thank you for your assistance.”
Cass Allura 11-Jun-19 09:32 PM
“Of course. You can count on me, Professor.” I close the book. “Also...I greatly respect what you’re doing for the hurting people of this land. I’m pleasantly surprised that your intellect is only matched by your care for the underprivileged.” I raise a hand. “I know you may or may not see it that way, but I do, so...thank you.” I think back to a conversation I had yesterday. “..together, I think we can really do good for this world.”
Professor Buff Orpington 11-Jun-19 10:46 PM
I nod. “Perhaps. But it is not something that can occur passively. This is a path that not only creates conflict, but demands it. It may demand of you to recognize that our opposition in this conflict may often be far from evil; simply powerfully misguided individuals holding a conception of good that valorizes submission to the old order - and all the institutions that includes - as the greatest good.”
Cass Allura 12-Jun-19 11:27 AM
I look away briefly, glancing at the tapestry of Cassandra, then back to you. “Unfortunately, I’m all too aware of that. I know now that this world exists in shades of grey, that history is gilded in fable, that even heroes can—” I catch myself, then give a sad smile. “I want to save everyone, even the misguided ones. I think everyone deserves a chance at being saved. But, if the misguided continue to hurt others, then...well, I know what must be done. It...it doesn’t make it any easier, though.”
Professor Buff Orpington 12-Jun-19 12:10 PM
I nod at this, thoughtfully. “Indeed. That is a noble pursuit, but a pursuit, I am afraid, I will not follow you in. I do not intend to waste my time or resources reforming the corrupt. We are better positioned than ever to truly influence the world we find ourselves in, and I will not allow this opposition to in any way water down any reforms we are able to create. They must step aside or finally face the justice they earned long ago-...” I find that I have been pacing throughout this rant and suddenly stop myself. “But... if you have any questions or concerns, they should already be addressed in my journal. If they are not, bring them to me.”
Cass Allura 12-Jun-19 12:55 PM
I give a bittersweet look, and for a moment you see just how tired I am. “Well...we both want to stop injustice. That’s the important part.” I give a soft smile. “I’ll look over these notes and get back to you. Thank you, Professor.”
Professor Buff Orpington 12-Jun-19 01:24 PM
I give you a penetrative look and nod to you as I head back towards my room.
Cass Allura 12-Jun-19 02:35 PM
As you’re leaving, I speak up. “Professor?”
Cass Allura 12-Jun-19 02:59 PM
The vision of Creissos, covered in ash and flame, flashes across my mind as I try to steel my gaze. “..we’ll find the green again.”

Cass Allura 12-Jun-19 06:58 PM

I blink. “Ah, Rook, I’m sorry. Yes, yes, that should work fine for me. Thank you for reminding me. I’ve been a bit scattered lately.”

I examine the ring more closely. “Apparently, it will help locate this particular creature, which is very helpful. Yeah, the price was kind of rough, but we needed to get these things right away, otherwise folks could get hurt, so I thought I would take the hit.” I look a little bummed, despite my words.

Professor Buff Orpington 19-Jun-19 09:29 AM
I pace uneasily in my room. My eyes are locked on some book, but my mind wanders ahead of the words on the page. The taunting look of Velec with the victorious face of Arcadia dance before me. I feel the same boiling rage I had felt after my return to the Grinning Rat; used and tricked, the manipulable brute that everyone took me for. I toss the book aside and attempt to focus on a problem. I picture the Methodology of Artifice in my mind and hold onto the potential it bears, until the problem of Starcross once again returns. Irritated, I pull out a piece of my custom-made paper and, without even moving to sit at my desk, begin to sketch a portrait. Though most of my experience lies in sketches of magical beasts and creatures, I manage a sufficient portrait. I charge straight into the hallway towards the bounty board and post the picture near Velec’s. I impatiently look in my pockets or on the board for an extra string, though failing to find one, I tear a piece of cloth from my robe and connect the two pictures. Finally, I stand back and take in my work. A portrait of a tiefling woman hangs with the name in large Common letters, ARCADIA.
1
Returning to my room, I slide a note under Cass’s door.
Cass Allura 19-Jun-19 11:08 AM
I’m in a dark hut, filled with burning incense, as a man watches me grapple with destiny. I’m at a campfire, my two compatriots sharing the dying light of warmth before continuing our trek. I’m on a mountain, flanked by the same Elf and Warden, grim determination filling my words as I climb onward. A flash of steel. A streak of red. Fire. Fire. Fire. Nothing. For a long time, nothing. Then— My mind races as I see a young girl approaching me across an endless gray expanse, dressed in blues and purples, with a rapier at her side and a song on her lips. But there are no songs here. I watch as she stares in horror at my arrival, falling to the ground at the sight of my visage. And why wouldn’t she? I am so much more than that foolish Sage intended. I have found an answer far outweighing the shallow ones of my ‘friends.’ I am Power itself, unbridled, unquelled destruction, and for the first time in a several millennia, I have found a path out. I raise my hand as I issue this proclamation and observe the fear in this foolish girl’s eyes. Does she see? Does she finally understand? Before the flames consume her, I watch as she realizes the immutable truth: she never stood a chance.
Cass Allura 19-Jun-19 11:16 AM
— — — I wake up with a start, barely capturing the scream in my throat as I scramble in desperation to a sitting position. I run my hands across various parts of my body, finally touching my face. Breathing a deep sigh of relief, I rest my head in my waiting hands and try to breathe steadily. After several minutes, I look around my room. ‘It’s just another bad dream, Cass. You’re ok.’ Trying to believe that, I swing my legs over my bed to meet the floor. I groggily rub my eyes as I try to start my day. In doing so, I notice a piece of paper slid under my door. I smile as I approach it. ’I’m sure Jayko will cheer me up somehow.’
1
I pick up the note and examine it.
Professor Buff Orpington 19-Jun-19 11:30 AM
The note reads: ‘New insights have caused circumstances to change. While withholding as much information as possible, I encourage you to cooperate fully with and ingratiate yourself to Arcadia. I have reason to believe she is at least a collaborator with the Starcross organization. If that is true, Starcross in Bluecliff is far from an organization in decline, but an organization in preparation for some action. Cooperating with Arcadia will ideally expose, to some degree, the nature or direction of this action. Whatever the ordeal or blackmail presented to you, accept it and trust that I will assist you in resolving it. Jayko and I will, ideally, by the time of your interview have infiltrated Rodrick’s Circle to some degree, allowing us to pursue this lead from every direction. Burn this note after reading. -Professor Buff Orpington’

Melchior Mori 25-Jun-19 04:53 PM
After his conversation with Jayko, Melchior starts to head towards his room before realizing that his mailbox is full. Inside is a long wooden box, wrapped in vines. He carries the box to his room carefully, inspecting the outside to see if there is a letter, but cannot find one. He places the box on his desk and slowly unwraps the vines holding the box shut. It is only when the box is open that the letter is found, he reads it over, eyes scanning the words and when he reaches the end his eyes dart back to the beginning, with a look of cautious excitement flashing over his face. After reading the letter a third time he places the paper to the side and pulls the item from the box, beneath the soft white cloth that was protecting it is a beautiful katana. He turns the sword over in his hand slowly admiring the black scabbard and the elegant hilt which is carved from the wood of the ancient cherry tree described in the letter. He takes the scabbard into his left hand and takes hold of the hilt with his right. There is a comfort in the grip despite the notches going up along each side of the hilt, almost as if the wood is emanating a little warmth. With a quick movement, he draws the sword from the scabbard, as he does cherry blossom petals materialize from the blade and float slowly to the ground. He examines the edge of the blade before making two slashes through the air, each leaving its own trail of petals in their wake.
I will need to be careful with this one, he thinks as he lowers himself to a sitting position on the ground. Once seated he holds the Sakura Branch in his right hand and summons a katana into his left. Much like the greatsword that he has grown accustomed to using, the summoned katana is a dark black with specks that glimmer like stars as they catch the light. The guard of the blade looks like a raven in flight, its wings going up along the back of the blade on either side. He sets the black katana onto the ground before him and rests the blade of the Sakura Branch on the palm of his left hand and focuses on the energy of the blade. Slowly over time, the black katana before him starts to lose form, going hazy at the edges as small cracks form along the blade. Eventually, the black blade turns to twinkling dust before melting into the shadows. He stands and takes the Sakura Branch into his left hand before tossing it into the air, as it reaches the apex of the toss it disappears. He smiles and holds his right hand out, focusing as the blade reappears in his grip. (edited)
2
Rook 27-Jun-19 08:19 AM
The door to the guild opens quickly as Rook slams it open trudging in slowly. Anyone in the vicinity senses a slight toxicity surrounding him in the air, and traces of purple fluid are seen on the corners of his tools hanging out of their pouch. He carries a large tarnished bell, runes glowing on the bottom. Setting it down on the table, and reaching into his bag for the rags he keeps there. He spends time meticulously cleaning his tools before returning them to his tool kit. And spends time cleansing himself of any remnants of the tin-adjacent smell he was emitting before taking a seat at the table to more carefully study the bell. (edited)

Melchior Mori 28-Jun-19 12:34 PM
As Rook and Jayko are finishing their conversation, Melchior walks through the door of the guild. His outfit is different than the one he left in. The simple black tunic from this morning has been replaced by a tunic comprised of intricate angular black and dark grey stitching. The stitching has an appearance of feathers when viewed from afar. Along the front of tunic is a golden trim joining the left and right sides together. The collar of the tunic dips in the front, and raises as it goes along Melchior's neck providing a nice silhouette. Above the tunic he wears a hooded cloak, as dark as night. It too has a golden trim along the front edges and hood. The cloak has flecks of gold around the bottom moving upwards, reminiscent of a stary sky. An empty black scabbard hangs from his sword belt, and it is accompanied by an intricate clockwork contraption. His face is blank as if he is lost in thought. "Rook is right, Cass would never let us hear the end of it." he says in an effort to make a joke, but there is no humor in his voice. (edited)

Cass Allura 28-Jun-19 04:18 PM
I enter the Guild at a somewhat faster pace, a look of slight concern on my face. While this is hardly new behavior, I look different than before, as I’m dressed in new clothes. A splendid outfit adorns me, one of sky and ocean blues and whites, with silver inlay forming crisscrossing lines across my torso, ending at a collar that goes halfway up my neck. Upon closer inspection, the fabric has a texture of small, interlocking scales, lacking the function of scale mail, although the cosmetic nature of the garment is just as impressive. The attached coat goes halfway down my thigh, expanding out in cascading furls that seem to ebb and flow like waves when I move. Similar to the torso, the silver inlay extends down the arms of the garment, flaring out at the wrists for ease of movement. It is perfectly fitting and of incredible quality, a true marvel of expert craftsmanship. I notice @MementoMori as I enter. “Hey! You took off before I could catch up. Did you not hear me call for—” I suddenly notice @ICraw and @noobmignon also in the room, giving a lingering look to the former. “Oh! Uh, sorry, didn’t mean to interrupt.”

This is sure to throw things back into our favor! Incredible work, Jayko,” I say, giving the Lizardfolk a grin and a wink.

Assuming that is our goal. At the moment, however, I am concentrating my energies and capital on building our power among the people of Bluecliff.”

Professor Buff Orpington 08-Jul-19 12:43 PM
I stand alone in my room. Slipping my inadequate replacement off of my form, I look down at my body and see a thick layer of dust and ash covering me almost entirely. Reaching for a nearby rag, I dampen it in a glass of water and begin to wipe my torso clean. As soon as it touches me, I grimace in pain and inspect the dull, red blister. I grit my teeth and begin wiping down the rest of me, a grim smile as a landscape of blisters reveal themselves. ‘Mother Mountain-Wanderer would be quite proud.’ I think to myself. The water turns a pinkish grey as I squeeze the cloth into my water glass. ‘After all those years of sitting and growing fat at the Academy, I will finally begin to look the part of a battle-scarred Goliath warrior.’
As I finish, I pull the gift from Loralith around me once more and head towards the bounty board. Reading the newest happening, an ambitious glint flashes in my eyes. I pull out a piece of paper and begin writing a note, which I post on the board as I finish: ‘Colleagues, This note was written by Professor Buff Orpington. Though I do not tend to be an individual who enjoys jollity and other acts of frivolous recreation, Sellathus’ Circus presents an opportunity for me to study first-hand some of the creatures outside of Creissos. I do not require any companionship, but I will allow myself to be accompanied as I attend. Inform me if you wish to do so. Sincerely, Professor Buff Orpington’
1
Jayko 09-Jul-19 07:32 AM
jayko slips out of his room. Usually jayko is not suspecting comrades of potential subterfuge or worse but jayko HAD seen worse. Jaykos mind raced from item to item; fungi, fae, rats, circle, adventurers guild. As jayko keeps an eye on the offenders room, the hulking figure of Buff opens the door next to jayko. Jayko slips into the shadows, white scales seemingly fusing into highlights thrown by the nearby torch and shadows melding with the shadows of the room. Jayko watches as buff places a letter into the bounty board amongst the other clutter. Jayko blinks as he reads it from afar, mind racing. "Creatures... Outside creissos...." Jayko emerges from the shadows beside Buff, curiousity overtaking him. "Does buff think... They have lizardfolk...?" (edited)
1
Professor Buff Orpington 09-Jul-19 08:51 AM
My heart quickens as I sense a threat approaching me from the darkness. Had Velec, after all these months of facing me, all of Creissos as our grand chessboard, finally decided to deal with his greatest and most ruthless rival? Or was it the Summer Champion, the enemy among me, finally determined to to end the fight with a quick stab in the back? Or was it Lady Montegnè’s assassins, bringing justice to whatever more I unintentionally violated? I reach for my weapon as I spin, but, feeling nothing but air, clench my fist instead, as I come to face... Jayko. “Ah... Jayko. Yes.” I pause for a moment to think. “Yes. I remember reading a short essay during my studies at the Academy that placed the origin of Lizardfolk in the marshes of Marseith in Sundessos. As for whether there will be any at the circus... perhaps. You are fascinating creatures, and at least personally, I would enjoy seeing how a native born, marsh-raised Lizardfolk would compare to one of your own origins, if any polymorphism arose, et cetera.” (edited)
Jayko 09-Jul-19 09:45 AM
jayko blinks at this "Jayko knows he is different... Jayko just wants to know he is not only different one." *Jayko sneaks a glance over buffs shoulder^ "The Professor of Buff... You make deal with fey, yes? What is the buff knowing of the fey?"
Professor Buff Orpington 09-Jul-19 10:24 AM
I grimace as I feel a cold chill on my shoulders and give an irritated look to the sky. “Yes.” I give the hallway a suspicious look and begin to speak in Draconic. “My knowledge of... those individuals, from an academic standpoint, is limited. But they have seen a potential in me, and in them I have seen a path to the power and knowledge I require to reshape this world.”
Cass Allura 09-Jul-19 10:31 AM
I enter the guild clearly deep in thought, absentmindedly brushing errant motes of ash and dust off my new clothes as I walk into my room. Once inside, I close my eyes as I shut the door, lean against it, and let out a long, shaky breath. Visions of our battle flash before my eyes. Rook and the Professor falling amongst broken stone to certain death. Jumping down to save them, with no real plan on how to save myself. Watching as the red draconic head rises from the lake of lava, joined by four others, ready to meet me and my fate. Bravery? No, it was stupidity. I acted on impulse to save them, but almost threw my life away in the process. I pound my fist against the door. 'Cass Allura, the next great martyr of Irs.' "..how are you supposed to save the world if you're dead?" My quiet question is met with indifference from my empty room. 'I need to think faster, think smarter. I need...' My hand instinctively goes to my side pocket, my fingers finding the soft leather of a small pouch. A pouch of playing cards. — — — 'You haven't used it.' 'Ah. Yes. Uh...it's....it's quite powerful.' 'Yes,' it nodded excitedly. 'It's also...quite dangerous.' 'Yes,' it nodded excitedly. — — — The conversation with the sprite echoes in my ears, one message finding purchase at the forefront of my mind. 'She has many more gifts than just this. Gifts tailored for you. But you must show your appreciation of the gift you have.' I think of my task, insurmountable by all estimates. I think of my current skill level and the long road I must walk until I can match her. I think of what I need now, more than anything. I pull out the pouch, looking down at this incredible weapon made of enchanted paper. I rest my fingers tentatively upon the edge of the cards. '..I need power.'
3
The sound of the Professor's door swinging open makes me jump, pushing my current thoughts from my mind. I let out another shaky breath. "..maybe someday. Maybe soon." I take a final look at the cards before stowing them. "But not now." Right now, I already have a task. 'Three Keys. Three Kingdoms.' I glance at the tapestry of Cassandra. "It's time to make some progress." I leave my room.

Professor Buff Orpington 03-Sep-19 08:11 PM
For the next few days, the common room of the Guild is abuzz with activity. The Professor paces back and forth in a room filled with papers, puzzling at a huge grid of numbers, while a diverse group of a dozen or so young people sort through papers, calculate numbers on abaci, write on the grid, and doze off to sleep on the Guild couch. Every few hours, the Professor will emerge from his trance, dramatically point out an error in the grid, and loudly ask if the group knew what they did wrong, before informing his familiarly weary-looking research assistants through a lecture on the importance of accurate data. On the second morning of non-stop work, the Professor eyes his slothful, unproductive team, all struggling to remain awake. He gives them an irritated look and quickly departs, only to return about thirty minutes later carrying two boxes filled with greasy, spiced mutton and sugary fried dough, reawakening the inspiration of the students.
4
nasterisks 08-Sep-19 06:20 PM
Locke walks down to the common room of the Guild, then down the hall—entering what had been Glurk's room. After removing a few last boxes from the room, he closes the door and locks it, pocketing the key. Walking past the ongoing work with the Professor ( @RockinRockhill ) and students, he stops momentarily and walks towards them.
"Professor, could I have a word with you?"
He gestures towards the bounty board, away from the commotion of activity at the table. (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 09-Sep-19 12:38 AM
I look at Locke for a second, then turn back, eyeing the progress of my assistants. I give a less than confident nod and move to join him. “Yes. Any mistakes made at this time can be corrected. What is it you would like to discuss?”
nasterisks 09-Sep-19 06:02 AM
Locke sets the boxes down, reaching into his pocket after doing so. He gives a half smile.
"Hard at work, eh? I think it's noble what you're doing."
Reading the expression on your face, he shrugs.
"A few of the students were talking. Not sure if it was meant to be a secret. Anyway..."
Extracting his hand from his pocket, you watch as he pulls a small note from his pocket. It's folded once-over; the paper itself similar to the summons you received weeks back from the Rodrick's Circle Militia Headquarters. He hands it to you.
"I meant to hand this back to you when you all came from your trip, but we've been missing each other the past few days. I was walking through the Merchant's Quarter when I ran into Lord Arcadia Cerath. She seemed in a... chipper mood when she told me that she had an invitation for the Guild."
He glances down at the note, then back to you with a sigh.
"You're all making friends in high places, it seems. Forgive me, but I read through it."
 (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 09-Sep-19 10:31 AM
I give this a weary grimace and snatch the note from his hands, wordlessly reading it.
nasterisks 09-Sep-19 10:58 AM
Locke gives you a tired look, watching as you finish the note.
"It could be worse, I've been to that dinner before. Despite the... interesting nature of the attendees, it's not a terrible way to spend an evening."
Locke continues to watch you, now with a sobering expression.
"Besides, I don't believe we have a lot of goodwill with the Lords. I think we've barked up some wrong trees over the past few months. Overstepping lines, in some cases."
 (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 09-Sep-19 11:26 AM
I rub the bridge of my nose and sigh. "When the spider invites you into its web, it is not usually considered a great honor... But I suppose you are correct, at least partially, though I care little for whatever lines of civility and decorum those people have placed to limit opposition. We are playing a game of chess against a grandmaster with an army of invisible pieces using only a handful of pawns and a rook. If we are thoughtful and deliberate, then it can only go two ways: alliances forged or enemies understood." I look to Locke. "If you have time, I would like to familiarize myself with the potential attendees." (edited)
nasterisks 09-Sep-19 02:15 PM
Locke shrugs.
"I've got time now. Its generally all the lords, along with some of the other 'elites' around the city. Sometimes there are visitors from outside the city—I think one year the King was present, but that was during wartime. If Knight Windmourn is still in Bluecliff, she'll likely be there."
He pauses.
"I'm assuming you don't want to know every single Lord in Bluecliff?"
 (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 09-Sep-19 02:20 PM
"As much as you can or are willing to share would be beneficial." I look back at the group of students handling thousands of individual survey results and smile, turning back to Locke. "As you might have noticed, I like to be as thorough as possible. But perhaps simply an overview of those, friends or foes, who you would deem worthy of special attention would suffice." (edited)
nasterisks 09-Sep-19 02:25 PM
Locke smiles in return.
"Certainly. I'll write something up and send it your way."
Picking up the box he had set aside, he nods in appreciation. He begins to head for the stairs before stopping, then turning around.
"Oh, and by the way, a man has come here a few times since you've been gone. I've asked for a message or address from him for you to follow through with, but he has declined to leave either. He says he wishes to speak with you and that he'll return here until you're back. So... look out for that, I suppose."
 (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 09-Sep-19 02:48 PM
I tense up at these words. "Ah... Good... I suppose I will wait for him then." I stand still for a few seconds, before spotting a student make a mistake in my peripherals and charge back to my work.
Professor Buff Orpington 25-Sep-19 11:01 AM
After a few minutes, I emerge from my contemplative trance with a thought. I reach deep into my pockets to search for a notebook, but feel my hands brush up against a loose sheet of paper. I draw it from my pocket and reread the note from Rook. Sighing, I rub the bridge of my nose as I head to his room and give his door a single knock.
Rook 25-Sep-19 07:25 PM

Professor Buff Orpington 25-Sep-19 10:12 PM
Rook’s shadow overwhelms me and for a few seconds, I stand frozen and silent, like in the library. “Yes. Your letter, your work with the Guild, and your cooperation with me has earned you the right to make your case. But unlike the others, I do not so quickly forget what I saw at the Blackforge.”

Rook 25-Sep-19 10:37 PM
“I understand as much” Rook steps aside to let the Professor in as he continues. “I would never ask that you forget, I only ask you understand my perspective. Until recently the only people I had not seen misuse Master technology was The Masters themselves.” At this Rook takes a seat in the rather large chair in the corner of the room gesturing towards another sizable chair at the desk upon which sits the book found in the Artificers lab. “Now I know I cannot simply trust the Masters. You have done much to have earned trust, and I misconstrued that, for that I apologize. However, seeing all I have seen, I ask only that you are honest with me in your findings and intentions.”
1
Professor Buff Orpington 25-Sep-19 11:32 PM
I nod thoughtfully and move to sit down, giving the Codex a long look, before turning back to Rook. “I do not ask for apologies or even trust. I ask for you to understand. I will act as I see fit in the knowledge that I act for the progress of this world. I know the path I have forged for myself is the only one that will bring Irs the prosperity and security it requires.” I lean forward, looking deep into Rook’s eyes. “And I ask that you watch me, with all the caution and distrust of a Goliath sharing their fire with a direwolf, so that if I stray from my path, you will do what is necessary. And know that if I sense you begin to lack the will to resist whatever evil may still live inside you, I will do the same.”
Rook 26-Sep-19 10:08 AM

I don’t know that I could resist a direct order from any Master. Should things go against plans, I hope you won’t hesitate.” I nod towards the codex “Once I finish that, I was hoping that you may look into it, I think together we may get a greater understanding of its contents”
Professor Buff Orpington 26-Sep-19 11:05 AM

But in the meantime, I would appreciate the opportunity to study the codex. Whatever knowledge lays inside should be understood and utilized if possible."

"He is the subject of the book I brought with me from the Blackforge... the Book of Legion. It seems he has associated with him a rare and extraordinary energy with sources beyond the arcane, known as Formlegion. I have pored through the text and all that even the rarest of the books at the Academy have to offer, yet the origins and nature of the energy remains a mystery."
Rook 26-Sep-19 12:44 PM

Rook 26-Sep-19 02:08 PM

Professor Buff Orpington 26-Sep-19 02:46 PM
"Very well. That is a start. This energy, or at least an understanding of this energy, would be of tremendous value, and I plan to study it, time and resources permitting. But in the meantime..." I stand and move to exit. "My students sound worryingly silent."

1
nasterisks 14-Oct-19 09:04 AM
As you work your magic, @ICraw, the dagger and the marble begin to appear in your mind not as items but as knowledge. The dagger comes easily enough, as necromantic runes fill your mind along with a sickly black pulse races through your subconsciousness. You learn the dagger's true-name and its effects:
[ Dagger of Venom ] | Rare Weapon (Dagger) | You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. You can use an action to cause thick, black poison to coat the blade. The poison remains for 1 minute or until an attack using this weapon hits a creature. That creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 2d10 poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The dagger can't be used this way again until the next dawn.
The smaller orb is more difficult to determine, as runic symbols you're unfamiliar with swarm your mind like a cacophonous choir. Whispers surround your thoughts as you attempt to focus—meanwhile, you struggle to find the true-words to identify it. Suddenly, silence... as everything clears revealing two runes as clear as a full moon on a pitch black night:
[ Xixulath's Mad Whispers ] | Very Rare Wondrous Item | Shi kul thora thyr' r'thal Xu morga chthl nndra mk'la. Fosl pkraed aiousj dema xlkej rotun soal epze kl'lsk ri'lksth. //// X I X U L A T H \\\\.
The amulet appears nonmagical in nature. (edited)
Rook 14-Oct-19 11:44 AM
“Odd, Jayko here is what you have found, but the orb... it’s interesting”
Jayko 14-Oct-19 11:45 AM
“Jayko just steal- finds in house, what makes interesting?”
Rook 14-Oct-19 11:55 AM
“It’s, well, it’s most definitely not from our world” I pick up the orb and gently roll it in my fingers “That’s all I can tell right now though”
Jayko 14-Oct-19 12:37 PM
Jayko pokes it tenderly “Jayko thinks maybe orb should be examined by one more powerful than us...” Jayko looks at the amulet “Jayko... does not know what to do with... is not magic. Jayko finds in house, but maybe the Loralith should know more...”
Rook 14-Oct-19 12:55 PM
“It’s a possibility, worst comes to worst, you can always sell it. I’m sure someone will like this... as for the orb, I agree, it needs to be seen by someone with... otherworldly knowledge”
“But perhaps it just needs to be concentrated on. Like many other items attachment to a person makes it show its true potential.”
Jayko 15-Oct-19 09:48 AM
jayko hovers on that thought "Does the Rooks masters know how to kill... A god?"
Rook 15-Oct-19 10:36 AM
“I am not sure, however we can certainly ask”
Jayko 15-Oct-19 01:26 PM
“Jayko waits for the response of the master then” jayko appears to set off towards @RalphusAdolphus door

Loralith is meditating in her room.

jayko knocks anyway (edited)
Loralith 16-Oct-19 01:12 PM
Loralith is startled out of her concentration by a rude lizard knocking on her door. She opens the door with a groan and looks at Jayko expectantly without saying a word.
Jayko 16-Oct-19 01:28 PM
“Jayko has...” jayko is fishing in his back for a moment and pulls out the red necklace we pulled from the mannequin “...this. Maybe the Loralith is knowing what it is”
Jayko also pulls out the mannequin and puts it on the ground

Loralith looks at the necklace, then at the mannequin, then back to the necklace. "It's a necklace. You might be able to fence it at the thieves' guild but otherwise it's probably just evidence."

nasterisks 04-Nov-19 09:12 AM
@Players The front door comes to a close on the floor above early in the morning on a crisp winter's day. Not an hour prior, a keen listener would hear hushed voices around the fireplace, the clinking of plate armor, and an adventurer's room latch quietly. Some hours later, some of you watch as Locke leaves @TapRepus 's room. In his left hand is a letter, which he finishes reading as he closes the door behind him and locks it. Wordlessly, he walks to the stairs and heads for his office. The next time Ubron's door is passed, the nameplate near it is empty. (edited)
nasterisks 04-Nov-19 09:53 AM
@Players On a particularly blustery day, members of the guild returning from a day of errands would find Locke sitting near the fireplace. In his hands: a simple token. While unknown to some, others would recognize the small token as an emblem of Brava, the forge goddess. Locke wouldn't speak as to what and how it happened. In fact, nobody spoke on it for a day or so. But the evidence was clear as day and the absence of his presence was felt by many. For some, a small semblance of relief; for others, a pit of despair and heartache. By the end of the week, @ICraw 's nameplate would be removed—his token of Brava placed neatly on the mantel above the fireplace in the common room.
nasterisks 04-Nov-19 10:16 AM
@jodavo A few days after Rook's departure, you awaken to find an object near the door. Walking over to it, you pick it up and see a blank sheet of paper.
Cass Allura 04-Nov-19 07:36 PM
“..hey, it’s Cass again. Allura.” Dumb. “You...obviously know that. Just...wanted to make sure you got my Messages. I know I sent a lot of—” The magic fades. I groan and recast the spell. “—I’m sure you’re busy. I spend most of my time at the Abbey lately, and I’m not even one of the Nine! I can’t imagine—” The magic fades. I curse in my empty room, ignoring my blurring vision. I recast the spell. “—I...I miss you, big guy. Yes, I trust your judgement, but…” My eyes are burning. When the tears finally fall, so does the façade: “I’m confused. I thought you were happy here? Content? Why didn’t you say—?” The magic fades. A concussive sob escapes my lips, no longer trapped in my throat. I sit in the silence, wracked with pain from the questions unanswered, the betrayal unaddressed, the words unsaid. “..goodbye.”
Cass Allura 04-Nov-19 08:43 PM
After some time to myself, I get ready for my day, hauling my increasingly heavier bag of books and scrolls over my shoulder, preparing for another afternoon at the Abbey. As I walk toward my door, I see a small piece of paper. I pick it up. Blank. Jayko. ”Distractions are good, Cass.” I take a deep breath, check my face in the mirror, then head to Jayko’s door. I knock.
“Jayko? I got your message—er, rather, lack of one. What’s up?”
nasterisks 04-Nov-19 11:19 PM
@jodavo The door creaks open, unlatched. It opens and you feel a cool draft, not unlike that of the basement level below the main floor of the guild. You feel a shiver run down your spine and, despite yourself, push the door slowly open to let the light in. There are many ways to explain what you see. A clean room, potentially clean for the first time in months, is one such way. Another would be a quiet room—again, likely for the first time in months. The smell of wood hits your nose first, just as the pit in your stomach forms. Jayko’s room has smelled like many things—some of which unexplainable—but wood is not one of them. The light illuminates an empty room, the third word used to describe the space and the most painful of the three. As you walk in numbly, the light glitters against objects set aside the wall—not unlike the crates in that house before... well, before everything happened. Crouching low, quietly so as not to scare this fear into reality, quiet so as not to acknowledge what you know to be true, you see three things. And it is in these three things the truth becomes unavoidable. It rings through you like a drumbeat. Along the wall are a crate of nearly 20 potions, a ream of blank paper, and an unmarked key quietly resting upon them. For a moment you pretend they’re forgotten. The moment passes as you understand them to be gifts. And like the three words used to describe this room, these things three break your heart as you accept the truth like an embrace: Jayko is gone. And he isn’t coming back. (edited)
nasterisks 05-Nov-19 09:06 PM
@Players Amongst the confusion, with arguably questionable timing, a note appears on Meta’s door one day. Fearing the worst, the note is read. Brow furrowed, the reader shares the contents with an exasperated—but perhaps inwardly relieved—tone: “Need to run some errands. Be back in a couple months. Brought Blinky Steve with me. Don’t sell my room—I’m not dead yet!” (edited)
Cass Allura 06-Nov-19 04:14 PM
I walk numbly toward the pile of items in Jayko’s now empty room. I pull out a potion, examining it, admiring how the grimy bottle hides the incredible potency of the concoction. A craftsman, through and through. I brush my hand across the ream of blank paper, smiling at their hidden utility discovered by our inquisitive rogue. I pick up the key, turning it in my hand. Simple. Unmarked. Unknown. But a key nonetheless, a helpful tool for unlocking something new. I admonish my dramatics. Jayko doesn’t think that way. He never did. These are just items. That’s all. That’s all. That’s— Tears on paper. Godsdammit. I look down and realize that I still have the paper in my hand, the one he slid under my door. A moment of hesitation, then I pull out a pen, sit on the floor, and begin to write: “..I tried so hard to make you think like me. To meet me on my level, not yours. That wasn’t fair. I’m sorry.” A pause: ”..thank you, Jayko. For everything. I wish you all the best.” A pause, then a smile: ”—Cassie”
— — — — — — After some time, I finally finish transferring the crates, papers, and the key into my room. “I’ll have to inventory this and pass it out soon. Without a cleric, we’ll need it.” I look down at the letter to Jayko on my desk, the empty wooden frame lying nearby. “Just one more thing to do.” I set up the frame, making sure it fits the letter snugly. I put it in place, put the glass on top, and position it on my wall. I step back, admiring the new decor. A letter to a friend, turned around in its frame, showcasing its important underside: a blank piece of paper.
Loralith 07-Nov-19 02:11 PM
Some time later, Loralith walks by the now empty room where Jayko used to reside. She slows her step for a moment and comes to a stop. She stands there, staring into the room quietly. She keeps a few thoughts to herself as she closes her eyes and takes a deep breath. A few seconds later, with her personal "goodbye" being said, she turns and continues onward.
Cass Allura 15-Nov-19 07:23 PM
I walk briskly into the Guild, muttering to myself, clearly deep in thought. I walk to @RockinRockhill’s door and knock twice. Then twice more. “Professor? I need to speak with you, if you have a moment?”
Professor Buff Orpington 15-Nov-19 07:28 PM
There is a long pause, then the door opens abruptly. “Ah. Cass. Of course. There is likely much to discuss.”
Cass Allura 15-Nov-19 07:29 PM
I nod and walk quickly inside. “Please, shut the door,” I say, clearly still distracted.
Professor Buff Orpington 15-Nov-19 07:34 PM
I finish writing a note and shut the door. I set the journal aside and wait for you to speak.
Cass Allura 15-Nov-19 07:53 PM
I turn toward you, a serious expression on my face. “I was working at the Abbey this week when I was introduced to a new guest from the Throne. Brother Sundry, a Warden—and former Knight of Iun.” I pause. “..I think.” I shake my head. “It doesn’t matter. The point is, he offered me a job.”
Professor Buff Orpington 15-Nov-19 08:26 PM
I furrow my brows at this and nod. “What is the job?”
Cass Allura 15-Nov-19 09:11 PM
I smile. “How would you like to interrogate a member of Starcross? The King himself requested it.” (edited)
1
Professor Buff Orpington 15-Nov-19 10:00 PM
I slowly nod, giving this prospect deep thought. “That is obviously intriguing and my immediate answer would be yes... But more information would be required before I commit. Who are we interrogating? What information does the Throne want? How much freedom will we be given? And why would the Throne trust us with this?”
Cass Allura 16-Nov-19 01:53 PM
I think for a moment. “Alright, in order: Istvan Tropus or Hadrath Ironbrand, the King wants information on their organization and motives, I assume a good amount of freedom considering the circumstances, and your guess is as good as mine,” I say with a light chuckle.
“Apparently, our exploits have reached far and wide. For better or more likely for worse.” I put my chin on my fist and smile. “Buuuut, Sister Cass clearly made a good impression with the Church, since they wanted me to spearhead the endeavor. Turns out, I occasionally have conversations with folks that don’t inevitably lead to conflict.”
Professor Buff Orpington 16-Nov-19 08:09 PM
“This is very good. We should be proud of the influence we are gaining in this world. It should be no surprise to you that I am wary of the Throne’s intentions, but we are in no position to turn away opportunities like this. If you need help convincing Loralith, let me know.”
1
Cass Allura 16-Nov-19 11:51 PM
My smile fades. “Yes...that may be a difficult conversation,” I say, sobering a bit. “I know how she feels about the Throne, and what they did was horrifying...but this is bigger. If we don’t stop Starcross and their Reconvergence, we won’t be facing another genocide—we’ll be facing extinction.” I look up to you with grim determination. “We need this lead. And we need Loralith.” (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 17-Nov-19 01:24 PM
“Indeed... Though it must be acknowledged that Khorlozaix did not create these rifts. He is merely exploiting them. There will be a reckoning for this world, and the crimes of the Throne, whether it be on Starcross’ terms or ours’. It would not only be just, but prudent not to waste this moment for a world after Starcross.”
Cass Allura 19-Nov-19 02:20 PM
My look is somber, though I can’t help but smile a bit, despite the stress. “..as always, very well-said, Professor. Redemption and forgiveness are hard roads to walk—but they’re necessary paths to progress.” I walk down the hall to Loralith’s room, turning back to @RockinRockhill as I approach her door. I nod my head toward her room, beckoning the Professor over. “Let’s put our words to good use, shall we?” (edited)
Professor Buff Orpington 19-Nov-19 02:40 PM
I puzzle, a bit surprised at this response, but choose to leave the matter settled for now. “Yes. Let us speak to Loralith.”
nasterisks 19-Nov-19 08:32 PM
